translation.en: [officer 1] Core and countdown one in two hours, 57 minutes.
translation.ko: 코어 및 카운트다운까지 2시간 57분 남았다 "넷플릭스 오리지널 다큐멘터리"

translation.en: The crew has arrived at the pad on schedule.
[officer 2] Copy.
Dragon's healthy and ready for crew ingress.
translation.ko: 드래건 이상 무 대원 탑승 준비 끝

translation.en: [woman] You're looking at the rocket that will return American astronauts

translation.en: to the International Space Station from American soil
for the first time since nearly nine years ago.
[man] Today's mission is known as Demonstration Mission-2, or Demo-2.
translation.ko: 오늘 미션은 데몬스트레이션-2 또는 데모-2라고 불립니다

translation.en: Demo-2 is the final test for NASA to certify SpaceX

translation.en: for regular crew flights to the space station.
translation.ko: 나사가 스페이스X를 대상으로 진행하는 마지막 테스트입니다

translation.en: [officer 1] Core and countdown one in T-minus two hours and 46 minutes.
The crew has arrived at the White Room. Its ingress is in progress on schedule.

translation.en: Stage one, LOX load, close out.

translation.en: [Elon] Earth is the cradle of humanity,

translation.en: It is time to go forth,
be out there among the stars,

translation.ko: 인간 의식의 범위와 규모를 더욱 확장해야 하죠

translation.en: [officer] Ten, nine, eight, seven, six,
five, four, three, two, one.
[Elon] There's this little candle of consciousness on Earth.
It hasn't been around for very long,
and it could easily go out.
It could be a meteor,
extreme climate change.
translation.ko: 극단적인 기후 변화에 꺼질 수도 있습니다

translation.en: Who knows? A third world war.
translation.ko: 그것도 아니면 3차 세계대전 때문일 수도 있죠

translation.en: Clearly, we need to preserve the light of consciousness into the future

translation.en: by becoming a multi-planet species, extending life beyond Earth.
translation.ko: 지구 외 여러 행성으로 삶을 확장해야 하죠

translation.en: Before starting SpaceX,
I was waiting for NASA to send people up to Mars.
Every year, I'd look at the NASA website, and I was like, "Well, it's hard to f--"
translation.ko: 매년 나사 웹사이트를 확인했는데 굉장히 답답했어요 "일론 머스크 수석 엔지니어, 스페이스X"

translation.en: [laughs] There just didn't seem to be a date for when we're sending people to Mars.
translation.ko: 언제쯤 화성에 인류를 보낼지 기약이 없는 듯 보였거든요

translation.en: In fact, uh, space, you could say, like,
"Look, we were able to go to the Moon in '69,
and our last mission to the Moon was in '72."
"And now here we are half a century later,
and still we have not gone back to the Moon."
The absolutely fundamental breakthrough
that's needed for humanity to become a multi-planet species

translation.en: is a rocket system that's fully and rapidly reusable.
translation.ko: 빠르게 완전한 재사용이 가능한 로켓 시스템이에요

translation.en: -[men] Yeah. -So, uh…
[man] For 50 years, NASA has been left behind.
As the NASA administrator,
I will tell you, that is a failure of our nation.
But now, through our partnership with commercial companies like SpaceX,
translation.ko: 하지만 이제 스페이스X와 같은 민간 기업과의 파트너십을 통해

translation.en: we have the opportunity to fix that.
If Mission Demo-2 is successful,
we'll launch American astronauts on American rockets from American soil
translation.ko: 미국 땅에서 미국 우주인을 실은 미국 우주선이 발사되는 거예요

translation.en: for the first time in nine years.
The ability to once again send our astronauts
to the International Space Station
is the first step in getting humans ready to go to Mars.

translation.en: Copy safety divers EV-1, copy safety divers EV-2, going to backup.

translation.en: [woman] Five GPH and work on the blue.
Alarms have been enabled, and we show no alarms that impact testing.

[Bob] Okay.
[man 2] Bob and I, we're laser-focused on what we need to do

translation.en: to get Dragon safely to Space Station

translation.en: We've been close friends
since we started as astronauts almost 20 years ago.
-[Doug] That feel better? -[Bob] Yep. That's good.
Doug's a meticulous pilot and extremely skilled at the same time.
translation.ko: 더그는 세심한 조종사에 굉장히 기술이 뛰어난 친구예요 "밥 벵컨 나사 우주비행사"

translation.en: It's a… a rare person that kinda can put both skills together
translation.ko: 두 가지 기술을 익힌 데다 실력도 굉장히 뛰어나죠

translation.en: where not only are they super good,
but they're also super good at staying out of trouble.
He's a Marine, right? And so he does have some of the stereotypical, uh, things

translation.en: about a Marine, so you need to know that.
translation.ko: 전형적인 해병대원의 모습을 보일 때도 있긴 해요

translation.en: Everything has a place, and I like things organized and symmetrical,
translation.ko: 뭐든 제자리가 있잖아요 저는 정돈되고 대칭된 게 좋아요

translation.en: and Bob… Bob's just… He doesn't have time for that stuff.
translation.ko: 밥은 좀 달라요 그럴 시간이 없다네요

translation.en: [Doug] It's just an override. It allows you to bypass…
He's got a tighter sense of hygiene than I do, I think.
translation.ko: 위생에 있어서는 저보다 더 깐깐한 거 같아요

translation.en: "Do you really want it cleaned that well?" "Yes, I do."
translation.ko: 그렇게까지 닦아야 하냐고 물으면 그렇다고 답하거든요

translation.en: [man] Try to give you as much flying as possible today, just to show you…
translation.ko: 오늘 최대한 비행할 거예요 그래야 설명이…

translation.en: [Doug] Bob's got an incredible mind.
He's just always a little bit ahead of everybody else.
translation.ko: 항상 남들보다 좀 더 앞서 있죠

translation.en: He's very analytical, very mechanical,

translation.en: He pictures it,

[Doug] Bob expects a lot out of himself.
We set pretty high bars for ourselves and each other.

translation.en: [Doug] You got a lot you need to get done,

translation.en: How confident are you that we'll see humans launch from US soil

translation.en: this year or in the summer?
Um, it's been 17 years, and we still haven't launched anyone yet.
translation.ko: 벌써 17년이 흘렀는데 유인선은 발사한 적이 없네요

translation.en: But hopefully, we will later this year.
Seems like you're feeling good about flying on it.
translation.ko: 두 분도 탑승에 기대가 큰 거 같고요

translation.en: Yeah, I think this is… this is what you wanna see.
You wanna see the team hitting its stride,

translation.en: that's for sure.
[Jim] We are doing everything we can

translation.ko: 1986년 챌린저호 폭발 당시 어디 있었는지 기억이 생생해요

This was the mission with Christa McAuliffe,

They brought in the TVs.
[officer] Challenger, go with throttle-up.
[reporter] What appears to be a major catastrophe in America's space program,

translation.en: Challenger, only seconds after leaving the launchpad,

translation.ko: 생존자가 있는지는 아직 확인되고 있지 않습니다

translation.en: [Bob] Spaceflight is an unforgiving environment.

translation.en: You know, you're riding a controlled bomb into space,

translation.en: and you're accelerating to 17,500 miles an hour.
Obviously, there is inherent risk.
With all of our experience on the NASA side,
having dealt with the risk,
Doug and I were a good fit, I think, for SpaceX.
That experience with the actual loss of a crew
was something that they felt was important for the crew members

translation.en: that were gonna work on developing a new vehicle.
translation.ko: 새로운 우주선을 개발하는 게 중요하다고 생각한 거 같아요

translation.en: Do you do it on the back one normally, Bob?
You know, Bob and I have been working with SpaceX for five years.
We're involved with the design.
And, of course, one of the things that we wanted Dragon to have
that shuttle didn't have is the abort system.
If something goes really, really wrong…
we'll be automatically separated from the booster
and parachute back down into the Atlantic.
translation.ko: 낙하산을 타고 대서양에 착륙하게 되는 거죠

translation.en: Today is the uncrewed test of this abort system.
translation.ko: 오늘은 무인 상태로 이 탈출 시스템을 실험할 거예요

translation.en: [host] Good morning, everybody. We are now actually live.
It's awesome, but I'm also just a little bit sad.
I don't wanna see a rocket intentionally blow up
and sacrifice itself for the safety of humankind's going to space,
translation.ko: "팀 도드 '에브리데이 애스트로넛' 진행자" 우주선을 폭발시켜야 한다니 가슴이 아파요

translation.en: but sometimes, that's what you gotta do, you know, so…
translation.ko: 하지만 필요하다니 어쩔 수 없는 일이겠죠

translation.en: I've been doing this full-time on YouTube for almost three years.
translation.ko: 전업으로 유튜브 채널을 운영한 지 약 3년 정도 됐어요

translation.en: I'll move closer so you have a sense of scale.
The point of Everyday Astronaut

translation.ko: 일반인들이 쉽게 우주를 접할 수 있게 도와줘요

translation.en: We're gonna be trying to track the rocket with this…
Thirty-five percent of my audience is in the United States. Sixty-five percent is an international audience.

translation.en: And so spaceflight is literally uniting people

translation.en: It's not… it's not just one person or one country. It is humanity.

translation.en: You're exploring together.
T-minus ten.
Five, four, three, two, one,
ignition.
Look at that! [laughs ecstatically]
We are in this. We are doing this.

translation.en: Yes!
Yes! Look at that!
-[laughing] Car alarms are going off! -[car alarms sounding] Car alarms are going off!
Oh, those clouds might ruin our shots here.
Here we go. It's gonna happen right now in the clouds.

translation.en: No!
We have to watch SpaceX's stream.
[officer 1] Vehicle is supersonic and passing through maximum dynamic pressure.

translation.en: [officer 2] Dragon launch escape initiated.
[officer 3] Dragon's away.
Okay, the major activity coming up.
[woman] Okay, you just saw a bright flash there.
It looks like Falcon 9 breaking up.
And there they are. Drogue chutes are out.
[Jim] Another amazing milestone is complete.
This was a very successful test.
It looked beautiful. [chuckles]
Yeah, obviously, I'm super fired up. This is great, you know?
[reporter] I was wondering how much data you were able to get after the breakup.
translation.ko: 폭발이 있은 후 얼마큼의 데이터를 회수했나요?

translation.en: [Elon] We lost telemetry on the first stage shortly after it exploded.
translation.ko: 폭발 직후 첫 번째 선체의 원격 측정기가 파손됐습니다

translation.en: There's definitely not any big pieces of the rocket left.

translation.en: Hi. Loren Grush with The Verge.
The explosion that happened today with the Falcon 9,
translation.ko: 만약 크루 드래건이 분리되지 않은 상태에서

translation.en: what would happen if an explosion like that occurred

translation.en: while the Crew Dragon was still attached? Is there any concern about that happening?

translation.en: It's much more a fireball than it is an explosion.
It should be, uh, really not significantly affected by a fireball.

translation.en: So it could quite literally, like something out of Star Wars,

Um, so that's, uh…
Obviously, we wanna avoid… avoid doing that, but… [laughs]
[woman] Well, thank you, all.
[reporter] Elon, doesn't this deserve a dance today?

translation.en: -[reporters laughing] -[reporter] Come on.

translation.ko: 계속 춤을 보길 기대할까 봐 걱정이네요

translation.en: -I… I'm not that good of a dancer. -[reporter] You are!
-I'm gonna have to work on my skills. -[reporter] You are.
translation.ko: - 연습 좀 해야겠어요 - 이미 잘 추세요

translation.en: No, no. I… I am not your dancing puppet.
translation.ko: 안 돼요 전 춤추는 꼭두각시가 아니에요

translation.en: [splutters] I'll tell you what, after crew launch, 100%.

translation.en: -[reporters laughing] -All right, it's good to see everyone.
[Doug] What we did this morning was almost a final exam for the system

translation.en: we're gonna fly here in a very short time.
[Doug] There's certainly a fair amount of work left to do.
translation.ko: 아직 할 일이 많이 남아 있긴 해요

translation.en: We've got final simulations.
But just to see the in-flight abort
translation.ko: 하지만 비행 중 탈출 실험도 하고

translation.en: and think about flying rockets again to the space station,
translation.ko: 다시 한번 우주정거장까지 우주선을 조종할 생각을 하니

translation.en: it's unbelievable.
I mean, nine years ago,
you know, I was the pilot on the last shuttle flight.
At that point, I didn't know if I was ever gonna fly again.
translation.ko: 그때만 해도 다시 비행을 하게 될지 몰랐어요

translation.en: [reporter] We're about to see something that none of us will ever see again,
translation.ko: 다시는 볼 수 없을 광경이 벌어질 예정입니다

translation.en: the launch of a space shuttle.
On the 135th and final space shuttle mission,
the shuttle program coming to an end after 30 years of flight.
[officer] Space shuttle spreads its wings one final time

translation.ko: 역사 속으로 아쉬움 가득한 여정을 떠납니다

translation.en: [Doug on radio] Houston station, Atlantis on the big loop.
translation.ko: 휴스턴, 여기는 애틀랜티스 전체 통신 채널로 말한다

translation.en: [man] Atlantis…
[reporter] Flying high over the Atlantic Ocean off the west coast of Africa,
translation.ko: 아프리카 서쪽 해변으로 대서양 위를 높이 납니다

translation.en: as we watch Doug Hurley up on the flight deck of Atlantis.
translation.ko: 애틀랜티스 조종실엔 더그 헐리가 앉아 있네요

translation.en: [Doug] I remember the last night we were in space.
Right before I went to bed, you know,

you know, you could just see,

And to see what's over that next bend and around that next curve
translation.ko: 이 곡선을 지나면 뭐가 있는지 다음 코너엔 뭐가 있는지 보려고

translation.en: is why I originally got into this business.
And, you know, knowing it was the last flight of the shuttle,
translation.ko: 우주왕복선은 이걸로 끝이란 걸 알았기 때문에

translation.en: just looking out and thinking about what was gonna happen after that,
uh, it was pretty tough.
[officer] With its signature sound of twin sonic booms piercing the predawn sky
translation.ko: 동이 채 트지 않은 하늘 위에서 음속 폭음이 두 번 울렸습니다

translation.en: as the space shuttle announces its arrival at the launch site,
having gone subsonic for the last time.
Hurley now deploying the drag chute.
[Doug] Hey, thanks to you and your team, Mike.
Until the very end, you all made it look easy.
The shuttle's always gonna be a reflection of what a great nation can do
when it dares to be bold and commits to follow through.
translation.ko: 용기와 헌신이 이뤄낸 업적으로 남을 거예요

translation.en: [woman] When I became Deputy Administrator of NASA,
anybody who looked at it knew
translation.ko: 프로그램을 들여다본 사람은 누구나 알았어요 "로리 가버 전 나사 부국장"

translation.en: that we had to retire the space shuttle program.
translation.ko: "로리 가버 전 나사 부국장" 우주왕복선 프로그램을 종료해야 한다는 걸요

translation.en: It was very expensive.
You know, we had already spent hundreds of billions of dollars
building it and keeping it going.
And it was also dangerous.
We'd lost astronauts twice.
translation.ko: 벌써 두 번이나 우주비행사를 잃은 상태였죠

translation.en: To replace the shuttle,
we ultimately ended up launching with the Russians in Russia.
translation.ko: 러시아에서 러시아인들과 함께 우주선에 오르게 됐어요

translation.en: [woman] The American space agency signed a new contract.
The US will pay about $82 million to Russia
translation.ko: 국제 우주정거장행 우주선에 우주비행사를 태워줄 때마다

translation.en: for every astronaut on board a flight to the International Space Station.
[Lori] On the New York media tour, Stephen Colbert asked the crew,
translation.ko: 뉴욕 미디어 투어에서 스티븐 콜버트가 물었어요

translation.en: "So what would you tell a kid today growing up who wants to be an astronaut?"
translation.ko: 우주비행사를 꿈꾸는 아이들에게 전할 말이 있느냐고요

translation.en: And Sandy Magnus answers,
"Learn Russian."
[man over PA] Three, two, one, zero.
[woman] Oh goodness.
[reporter 1] The end of an era in Florida.
One of Cape Canaveral's most storied launch sites
translation.ko: 케이프커내버럴에 있는 가장 오랜 발사 기지 중 한 곳이

translation.en: was imploded this morning.
[reporter 2] Forty years of space history is being dismantled and demolished,
translation.ko: 40년에 걸친 우주 역사가 해체와 철거를 거듭하고 있습니다

translation.en: just one more sign that human spaceflight is coming to an end.
translation.ko: 인류 우주 비행의 종말을 알리는 또 하나의 신호가 아닐까 싶은데요

translation.en: [Doug] It was really a tumultuous time, I think, especially for the astronauts.
Things were changing pretty drastically,
and we weren't really sure kinda what was gonna happen.
[Lori] We needed something very different,
so we had to create a new program,
which required turning to the private sector.
translation.ko: 그러다 보니 민간 기업체로 눈을 돌리게 됐어요

translation.en: [Obama] We will partner with industry,
we will invest in cutting-edge research and technology,
and by 2025,
we expect new spacecraft designed for long journeys
translation.ko: 장기 비행이 가능한 새로운 우주선을 설계해

translation.en: to allow us to begin the first-ever crewed missions
beyond the Moon into deep space.
And a landing on Mars will follow.
-And I expect to be around to see it. -[people applauding]
translation.ko: 제가 살아있는 동안에 성공할 거라 믿습니다

translation.en: Thank you.
[Lori] I thought tapping into the private sector was really a symbol of innovation.
translation.ko: 민간 부문을 활용하다니 혁신 그 자체라고 생각했어요

translation.en: Of course, there were a lot of questions and concerns.
Like if companies are on the Moon, does that mean they own it?
translation.ko: 기업체가 달에 착륙하면 달을 소유하게 되는지 등요

translation.en: So I thought we'd need new laws,
translation.ko: 그래서 새로운 법이 필요하다고 생각하긴 했지만

translation.en: but I was pretty sure that
the private sector would get us over the hump.
translation.ko: 민간 부문에서 장애물을 극복할 거라 믿었죠

translation.en: Getting everybody to agree was the challenge.
translation.ko: 사람들의 동의를 얻는 건 여전한 숙제였고요

translation.en: I want order in this hearing room.
I find serious flaws in the president's proposal
translation.ko: 여전히 개발 중으로 성공 여부가 불확실한

translation.en: that relies on a still-developing commercial sector
translation.ko: 상업 부문에 의존하겠다는 대통령님의 제안에 대해

translation.en: that may not be able to deliver.
Safety has been…
[Lori] You know, change is hard.
The relentless momentum of the status quo
of a tens-of-billions-of-dollar government program
translation.ko: 수백억 달러를 들인 정부 프로그램의 질긴 관성은

translation.en: is a lot to overcome…
[laughing] …and people went batshit crazy on us.
The proposal by the administration…
…is a bad idea.
…will be, in a word, devastating.
Many of the companies are start-ups.
We're not sending cases of Tang into space.
Future generations will learn how the Chinese, the Russians,
translation.ko: 미래 세대는 어쩌다 중국과 러시아, 심지어 인도가

translation.en: and even the Indians took the reins of human space exploration away…
translation.ko: 미래 세대는 어쩌다 중국과 러시아, 심지어 인도가 인류 우주 탐험의 고삐를 쥐게 됐는지 배울 것이며…

translation.en: [Lori] The industry feared new entrants.
You're in the club if you're a big aerospace company.
translation.ko: 대형 항공우주 회사라면 하나의 클럽에 속하게 돼요

translation.en: There's a lot of revolving doors between astronauts
who then go to companies,
and it became us versus them.
translation.ko: 그러다 보니 정부 대 기업 대결 구도가 만들어진 거예요

translation.en: [man] I want to welcome Mr. Neil Armstrong, who was commander of Apollo 11,
Eugene Cernan, who was commander of Apollo 17.
translation.ko: 아폴로 17호 선장 진 서넌의 참석을 감사드리며

translation.en: And we will start with you, Mr. Armstrong.
There will be overlooked requirements and unwelcome consequences.
translation.ko: 간과한 요건이 있을 거고 달갑지 않은 결과가 생길 겁니다

translation.en: This proposal has no focus
and is, in fact, a blueprint for a mission to nowhere.
translation.ko: 아무 데도 가지 못할 미션을 위한 청사진이라고 생각합니다

translation.en: You had to hold me down in my seat. I was… I was so… [laughs] I was so upset.
translation.ko: 저를 주변에서 말려야 할 정도였어요 너무너무 화가 났거든요

translation.en: And I was not the only one.
I was very sad to see that, uh, because those guys are… Yeah.
translation.ko: 보면서 굉장히 슬펐어요 왜냐하면 그분들이야말로… 착잡하더라고요

translation.en: You know, those guys are heroes of mine, so it's really tough.
They inspired you to do this, didn't they?
translation.ko: 이 일도 그분들에게서 영감을 얻은 거죠?

translation.en: Yes.
[interviewer] And to see them casting stones in your direction…
translation.ko: 그런데 그분들이 이 일에 대해 반대를 하시니…

translation.en: It's difficult.
I… I wish they would come and visit and see what we're doing here.
translation.ko: 저희가 어떤 일을 하는지 오셔서 보시면 좋을 거 같아요

translation.en: And I think that would change their mind.
[man] Why is this not working?
I've worked for SpaceX for years now.
Can't turn it on.
And in that time, of course, SpaceX has had lots of successes.
Come on.
But also, you know,
it's had its fair share of failures.
For many failures that we had, I felt like we could have done better here or there.
translation.ko: 실패한 경험을 여러 번 돌아보며 달랐으면 어땠을까 생각도 했지만

translation.en: But this is what the business is, right?
translation.ko: 이 일 자체가 그런 거 아니겠어요?

translation.en: You make mistakes, and you fix them the next time.
Okay, you see it works.
The great thing about Elon
is that he understands that failure is part of the development,
translation.ko: 실패가 개발의 과정이란 걸 이해한다는 거예요

translation.en: and he's been that way ever since the day I met him.
I decided one day to go to an amateur rocket weekend.
translation.ko: 한번은 아마추어 로켓 주말 모임에 간 적이 있어요

translation.en: All right, let's go. Let's go fly.
[Hans] We ran into Elon Musk there
and talked a little bit about rockets and… and plans what to do.
translation.ko: 로켓과 앞으로의 계획 등을 얘기하게 됐어요

translation.en: And then he asked me
if I'd be interested in working at a company
to build a rocket and go to Mars.
If you say Mars in Germany,
people will just laugh at you and think you're crazy.
It took me ten milliseconds to just say yes.
translation.ko: 저는 그러겠다고 대답하는 데 100분의 1초도 안 걸렸어요

translation.en: [reporter 1] In a warehouse near the Los Angeles Airport,
translation.ko: LA 공항 주변 창고에서 머스크와 직원들이

translation.en: Musk and his staff are building a rocket they call the Falcon.
translation.ko: 팔콘이라 이름 붙인 로켓을 제작 중입니다

translation.en: Musk is no rocket scientist.
He's a dot-com millionaire many times over.
Now he says he can do what NASA has not,
translation.ko: 그런데 나사도 못 한 걸 본인이 할 수 있다고 합니다

translation.en: jump-start the space age.
I… I had somewhere in the order of 100 million to invest…
…and thought we could at least do some good for the advancement of space exploration.
translation.ko: 우주 탐험에 조금이나마 도움이 될 거라 생각했어요

translation.en: [reporter 1] Falcon 1 is expected to launch this fall.
Elon Musk's fortune will be riding on it.
translation.ko: 일론 머스크의 투자금이 우주선에 실린다고 할 수 있습니다

translation.en: [woman] Hans introduced me to Elon.
And I'd been in this industry for 15 years,
translation.ko: 이 업계에서 15년을 일했는데 "그윈 쇼트웰, 스페이스X 회장 겸 최고운영책임자"

translation.en: and I saw what could be done and wasn't being done.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 데도 외면당하는 일을 많이 봤어요

translation.en: And I really felt like, if anyone was gonna break through the mire
translation.ko: 이 산업 곳곳에 침투한 관료주의적 관성을

translation.en: of a very bureaucratic industry,
Elon and SpaceX was kind of the last opportunity.
translation.ko: 일론과 스페이스X가 마지막 기회일 거라 생각했어요

translation.en: [Elon] These are dispersed rocket parts.
Parts for the stages, parts for the engines.
translation.ko: 선체 부품도 있고 엔진 부품도 있죠

translation.en: [Gwynne] I remember the early days of SpaceX. It was a small team.
But when you can all rally around one project,
translation.ko: 그런데 하나의 프로젝트를 위해 모두가 힘을 합치니

translation.en: magic can happen.
We were all focused on exactly the same thing,
getting Falcon 1 to orbit.
On the fuel side, we're gonna add a port rather than mess with the valve.
translation.ko: 연료 쪽엔 밸브는 놔두고 포트를 더할 거예요

translation.en: So we'll just…
[Elon] Designing an orbital rocket,
translation.ko: 지구 궤도를 도는 로켓을 설계하는 건

translation.en: it's… it's not the mad scientist, like, "Yeah, I've got the idea." It's…
translation.ko: 생각만 한다고 짜잔 하고 이뤄지는 마법이 아니에요

translation.en: It's just a monumental amount of work.
Everything, the engines,
software, hardware, down to the nuts and bolts,
was redesigned for the modern era.
translation.ko: 새로운 시대에 맞게 다시 설계해야 했어요

translation.en: [Hans] It's extremely difficult to build a rocket from scratch.
translation.ko: 로켓을 처음부터 만드는 건 정말 어려운 일이었어요

translation.en: Falcon 1 is a two-stage rocket.
Basically, the rocket launches, and the first stage burns out.
translation.ko: 로켓이 발사되면 첫 번째 선체는 기능을 다해요

translation.en: The two stages separate,
and the second stage ignites to get to orbit.
translation.ko: 두 번째 선체가 점화하면서 궤도에 진입하죠

translation.en: And rockets are unforgiving.
One design error, and… and everything is… is over.
translation.ko: 한 곳이라도 오류가 있으면 그걸로 끝이에요

translation.en: [Elon] At that point, I was not sure whether success was even possible.
translation.ko: 그때는 성공이 가능하긴 한 건지 의심이 들었어요

translation.en: I told the team I'd have enough money for three flights,
translation.ko: 세 번 비행할 자금이 남았다고 팀원들에게 말했죠

translation.en: and then that'll be it, you know.
Curtains if we didn't make it in three flights.
translation.ko: 비행 세 번 안에 성공하지 못하면 다 끝이었죠

translation.en: [Hans] We understood what was on the line.
So we worked on it for four years.
I had no doubts ever.
I was just so focused on building the company
translation.ko: 회사를 만들어 나가고 로켓을 발사하는 데만

translation.en: and… and getting… getting the rocket to fly.
[officer 1] Five, four, three, two, one, zero.
Plus one, plus two, plus three, plus four,
plus five, plus six, plus seven,
plus eight, plus nine, plus ten.
This is the LC on the countdown net.
Falcon 1 is airborne at this time.
[officer 2] We have a loss of signal there.
[Elon] About 30 seconds after liftoff, the engine shut itself off.
[Hans] The really hard part was collecting the pieces the next day.
translation.ko: 다음 날 잔해를 수습할 때가 정말 힘들었어요

translation.en: We'd worked on it for years, and suddenly everything was over.
translation.ko: 몇 년을 쏟아부었는데 모든 게 갑자기 끝나 버렸죠

translation.en: I came back home after a couple days,
and my wife told me I did not talk at home for two months.
translation.ko: 아내가 저보고 두 달 동안이나 가족과 대화가 없었다고 했어요

translation.en: I had… It took me… It took me so long to just get over this and… and… and collect myself
translation.ko: 이 실패를 잊고, 심기일전해서 두 번째 로켓을 계속 만들기까지

translation.en: and then continue working on… on rocket number two.
[officer] Five, four, three, two, one.
[Hans] A year later, our second attempt failed.
And the year after our second attempt, our third launch failed,
translation.ko: 그리고 두 번째 시도 1년 후 세 번째 발사가 실패했죠

translation.en: and we knew the company was in a bad place.
translation.ko: 회사가 궁지에 몰렸단 것도 너무 잘 알았어요

translation.en: [Elon] We were running on fumes at that point. We had virtually no money.
translation.ko: 자금이 바닥난 상태에서 겨우 굴러가고 있었어요

translation.en: Uh, that was… that was definitely the worst year of my life.
translation.ko: 제 인생 최악의 한 해를 보냈죠

translation.en: And I never thought I was someone who could ever
translation.ko: 제가 신경 쇠약에 걸릴 수 있을 거라고는

translation.en: be capable of a nervous breakdown,
but I… I felt this is the closest I've ever come,
'cause it… it seemed pretty, pretty dark.
[Hans] I was pretty depressed at the time.
You know, three failures in a row,
um, wasn't really a testament of… of great engineering.
Elon pulled us in a big conference room,
and I expected him to say, "You guys suck,"
and stop it at this point,
but he was just the opposite.
He was actually saying,
"I want you guys to fix everything
and launch another rocket as fast as you can."
He put all the money that he had into SpaceX
translation.ko: 가진 돈을 전부 스페이스X에 털어 넣었는데

translation.en: and was doubling down, basically, on… on… on this.
translation.ko: 판돈을 두 배로 올린 거나 마찬가지였어요

translation.en: And… and I was really, "Whoa, okay, that's, uh…"
I didn't expect that.
[officer] T-minus 30 seconds.
Deck one is triggered.
[Gwynne] I knew NASA was watching our flights,
translation.ko: 나사가 저희의 비행을 지켜보고 있었기 때문에

translation.en: and so we needed to get Falcon 1 to orbit
to prove that we could earn the right to work with them.
I think Elon was even more nervous, um, than I was.
translation.ko: 일론은 저보다도 더 불안해했던 거 같아요

translation.en: [officer] Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five,
four, three, two, one.
We have liftoff.
Oh fuck.
[Elon] Come on, baby.
Please tell me that's second-stage lights.
-[grunts] Fuck. Thanks. -We're already 2B.
Thank fucking God.
I mean, whatever.
-Thank whoever. Fuck. -[laughing]
Come on. Just fucking hold, you fucker.
It's hard getting to orbit, but we learned a lot on flight one,
translation.ko: 궤도에 오르는 건 어렵지만 첫 번째 비행에서 많이 배웠고

translation.en: we learned a lot on flight two,
and we learned a huge amount on flight three.
translation.ko: 세 번째 비행에서는 정말 많이 배웠어요

translation.en: And we were ready to fly.
-[man 1] Second stage approaching SECO. -[whooshing]
translation.ko: 두 번째 선체 엔진 차단 예정

translation.en: -[man 2] And that would be a nominal SECO… -[all cheering]
…which means Falcon 1's the first privately developed launch vehicle
to reach Earth orbit from the ground.
This is one of the greatest days of my life,
and I think probably for… for most people here.
translation.ko: 여기 계신 여러분에게도 마찬가지 아닐까 싶습니다

translation.en: We've shown people we can do it, and this is just the first step of many,
translation.ko: 우리도 할 수 있단 걸 보여줬어요 앞으로 더 많이 보여줄 거고요

translation.en: ultimately getting to Mars.
And I think the future of SpaceX is really great.
[interviewer] In the history of spaceflight,
only four entities have launched a space capsule into orbit
translation.ko: 오직 네 개의 독립체가 우주 캡슐을 궤도에 발사한 뒤

translation.en: and successfully brought it back to the Earth,
the United States, Russia, China, and Elon Musk.
translation.ko: 미국, 러시아, 중국 그리고 일론 머스크가 있습니다

translation.en: NASA called and told us that we'd won the $1.5 billion contract.
translation.ko: 나사에서 전화가 왔어요 저희가 15억 달러 계약을 땄다고요

translation.en: And I couldn't even hold the phone.
I was like… I just blurted out, "I love you guys." [laughs]
[reporter] SpaceX again successfully launched its Falcon rocket.
translation.ko: 스페이스X가 또 성공적으로 팔콘 로켓을 발사했습니다

translation.en: [man 1] Today will be the fifth Falcon 9 launch.
translation.ko: 오늘로 다섯 번째 팔콘 9 발사가 이뤄질 텐데요

translation.en: [man 2] Today we'll be placing a communication satellite…
[man 3] …a TV satellite into space.
[woman 1] 23 satellites, geostationary orbit.
-[man 4] SpaceX… -[man 5] SpaceX…
[woman 2] SpaceX plans to launch a dozen commercial satellites a year.
translation.ko: 스페이스X는 1년간 상업 위성을 총 12개 발사할 예정입니다

translation.en: [man 6] SpaceX may be in the lead to win NASA's confidence,
translation.ko: 스페이스X가 먼저 나사의 신뢰를 얻긴 했지만

translation.en: but SpaceX isn't alone.
-You're creating, like, spaceships. -Yeah.
-Yes! -[laughs]
[man 7] Musk and Bezos are dueling for contracts
to supply the International Space Station.
translation.ko: 물품 공급 계약을 따내기 위해 경쟁 중입니다

translation.en: The third space billionaire, Branson,
translation.ko: 우주 업계의 세 번째 억만장자 브랜슨은

translation.en: wants to create a space tourism industry for hefty fees.
translation.ko: 아주 비싼 우주여행 산업을 만들고자 합니다

translation.en: [Branson] You wouldn't imagine that something shaped like that
would fly so gracefully and so beautifully.
[man 7] Somehow it all seems a little less noble than in the early days.
translation.ko: 어째 초창기보다는 좀 고상하지 못한 거 같네요

translation.en: Perhaps space travel today is all about money and ego.
translation.ko: 어쩌면 오늘날의 우주여행은 돈과 자존심 문제일 수도 있겠네요

translation.en: [man] Thanks for not lighting this place on fire.
-[Elon] You're welcome. -[man laughs]
How does one decide to just make a flamethrower?
Well, I'm a big fan of Spaceballs the movie,
and in Spaceballs,
Yogurt goes through the merchandising section,
and they have a flamethrower.
-Spaceballs the Flamethrower! -[all] Ooh!
The kids love this one.
Does anybody tell you no? Does anybody go, "Elon, um…
…selling a flamethrower, the liabilities"?
translation.ko: 화염방사기 때문에 법적 문제가 생길 수 있잖아요

translation.en: -Yeah, it's a terrible idea. Terrible. -[man laughs]
[Elon] I said, "Don't buy this flamethrower. Don't buy it."
Still, people bought it. I just couldn't stop them.
translation.ko: 그래도 사더라고요 막을 수가 없었어요 "그래도 재미는 있어요"

translation.en: Elon… [chuckles] …you know, he's gonna do what he's gonna do.
translation.ko: 일론은 하고 싶은 건 꼭 하는 사람이에요

translation.en: I mean, he has an Iron Man suit in the middle of the factory floor.
How does it work? Do people get upset at you if you do certain things?
translation.ko: 어떻게 돌아가나요? 특정 행동을 하면 사람들이 화를 내는 건가요?

translation.en: There's tobacco and marijuana in there. That's all it is.
translation.ko: 담배랑 대마초를 넣고 말았어요 다른 건 없어요

translation.en: [man 1] Oh, here we go. Elon Musk back making headlines.
That is his specialty.
[Lori] Elon was out there, you know, creating lots of stories.
And so I didn't have any reason to believe at first he'd be the one.
translation.ko: 그래서 처음엔 일론이 해낼 거라 생각하지 않았죠

translation.en: [man 1] Now he took a lot of heat for smoking marijuana on camera.
translation.ko: 카메라에 대고 대마초를 피워 논란의 중심에 섰습니다

translation.en: He was ridiculed for his wild middle-of-the-night tweets.
translation.ko: 한밤중에 황당한 트윗을 올려 비웃음을 사기도 했고요

translation.en: [man 2] What is going on with Elon Musk?
translation.ko: "420달러에 테슬라 비공개 전환 고려 중, 자금은 확보" 일론에게 무슨 일이 일어나고 있는 거죠?

translation.en: He's an eccentric billionaire, I suppose. So an eccentric sense of humor as well.
translation.ko: 별난 구석이 있는 억만장자예요 유머 감각도 독특하고요

translation.en: [Doug] He's a human, just like the rest of us.
You know, we all have our pluses and minuses.
To be out there among the stars, I… I find that incredibly exciting.
translation.ko: 별들 사이에 있을 생각을 하니 정말 흥분되네요

translation.en: -That makes me glad to be alive. -[crowd cheering]
[Doug] But I don't think it has anything to do with individual antics
or individual wealth.
This is a much greater vision
that he has for not only society but the planet.
translation.ko: 이 사회와 더 나아가 지구라는 행성을 위해서요

translation.en: That hasn't changed.
And he demands a lot of everyone around him,
translation.ko: 일론은 주변 사람 모두에게 많은 걸 요구해요

translation.en: I think as much as he demands out of himself,
and, you know, he's relentless.
You decided to build a space company.
Why on Earth would someone do that?
-Got that question a lot. That's true. -[all laughing]
The big innovation is still ahead, and you're working on it now.
translation.ko: 여전히 진정한 혁신을 위해 노력 중이라고 들었는데요

translation.en: Tell us… tell us about this.
Uh, the goal of SpaceX is to try to crack a problem that I think is vital
translation.ko: 스페이스X는 인류가 자유롭게 우주여행을 하기 위해

translation.en: for humanity to become a spacefaring civilization,
translation.ko: 꼭 해결되어야 하는 문제를 풀어내려고 노력 중이에요

translation.en: which is to have a… a rapidly and fully reusable rocket.
translation.ko: 빠르게 완전한 재사용이 가능한 로켓을 만드는 거죠

translation.en: The space shuttle was an attempt at a reusable rocket.
translation.ko: 재사용 가능한 로켓을 만들려고 우주왕복선 때도 시도는 했지만

translation.en: But even the main tank of the space shuttle
was thrown away every time.
So it's possible to achieve, let's say, roughly a hundredfold improvement
translation.ko: 그러니까 이게 가능해져요 로켓만 효율적으로 재사용할 수 있게 되면

translation.en: in the cost of spaceflight if you can effectively reuse the rocket.
translation.ko: 우주 비행 비용의 효용도 약 100배 정도가 상승하는 거예요

translation.en: [Lori] A general estimate of how much we have spent
translation.ko: 아폴로 이후 인류의 우주 비행에 투입된 예산 규모는

translation.en: in human spaceflight since Apollo is around $350 billion,
and we send about 350 US astronauts to space.
So it's about a billion dollars a person.
translation.ko: 한 사람당 약 10억 달러의 비용이 투입된 거죠

translation.en: So being able to lower that cost is just such an obvious goal,
translation.ko: 이렇다 보니 비용을 절감하는 게 당연한 목표가 됐어요

translation.en: or you're never going to go anywhere.
In order to make spaceflight cheap,
and in order to land on Mars and do all these things,
you have to have a fully reusable rocket.
It's really common in space movies and science fiction to see…
translation.ko: 우주 영화나 SF에서 흔히 볼 수 있는 거죠

translation.en: Retros on!
[Tim] …you know, the sci-fi vision of the rocket that can take off and land anywhere.
That's so far away from what was even considered possible.
translation.ko: 완전한 불가능의 영역이라 꿈도 꿀 수 없다고 생각했어요

translation.en: Like, that's really, really, really hard to do.
[man] In fact, no one had ever tried to land an orbital booster.
translation.ko: 궤도 추진체의 착륙을 시도한 경우는 없었어요

translation.en: Landing a rocket certainly seemed absurd when we first started trying it.
translation.ko: 그래서 처음엔 착륙 시도 자체가 터무니없게 느껴졌죠

translation.en: To get it right, you have to set down this thing
that is the size of a skyscraper and weighing 30 tons
and land it on this speck in the middle of the ocean.
translation.ko: 그것도 바다 한가운데 작은 점 위에요

translation.en: At any point, any part of that can go wrong,
translation.ko: 어느 부분, 어느 단계든 잘못될 수 있고

translation.en: and it'll only end one way, which is in an explosion.
translation.ko: 모든 오류는 폭발로 끝나게 돼 있어요

translation.en: [Tim] SpaceX is not afraid of failure. They almost embrace failure.
"Hey, we're gonna test this. It might blow up."
translation.ko: 폭발 가능성이 있는 실험을 앞두고도 이렇게 말해요

translation.en: "If it blows up, we'll learn something."
[Jim] The way a traditional partner with NASA works,
translation.ko: 기존 나사 파트너들은 정해진 방식대로 일했어요

translation.en: everything all along the way
is qualified before it ever gets on the vehicle.
translation.ko: 우주선에 조립되기 전에 승인을 받아야 했죠

translation.en: SpaceX does things very differently.
The two philosophies couldn't be more opposite.
You'll see NASA literally solving everything on paper,
translation.ko: 나사는 모든 걸 이론적으로 먼저 풀어내야 하죠

translation.en: and SpaceX is literally building stuff, seeing what breaks,
translation.ko: 하지만 스페이스X는 일단 만들고, 취약한 부분을 찾고

translation.en: and then iterating from there.
They're developing a rocket around those explosions.
translation.ko: 수많은 폭발을 감수하며 로켓을 개발하고 있는 거예요

translation.en: That's why it's important to have a lot of launches and make a lot of rockets.
translation.ko: 그래서 더 많은 로켓을 만들어 발사하는 게 중요해요

translation.en: Every rocket, every launch is an opportunity to improve.
translation.ko: 모든 로켓, 모든 발사가 발전할 수 있는 기회니까요

translation.en: [Gwynne] Obviously, we get unhappy about failures that we have,
but we also are pleased with the results that come out of failures.
translation.ko: 그 실패로 인한 결과에는 상당히 만족하고 있어요

translation.en: You never know your system
until you've pushed it to the limit so that it breaks.
translation.ko: 시스템이 파괴될 때까지 한계를 밀어붙여 봐야 해요

translation.en: [Lars] One of the reasons people had imagined reusable rockets
translation.ko: 재사용 가능한 로켓을 많은 이가 꿈꿨음에도

translation.en: but had never achieved it
is that we'd never cracked precision landing.
translation.ko: 정확한 착륙의 열쇠를 풀어내지 못했기 때문이에요

translation.en: After the rocket launches,
the booster stage separates
and then flips around to shoot back towards Earth.
So we had to figure out
how to get a rocket that's moving seven times the speed of sound
translation.ko: 음속의 7배로 움직이는 로켓을 어떻게 목표 지점에

translation.en: back to its target.
First, we developed the legs,
the engines, the actuators and sensors, and some very advanced algorithms.
translation.ko: 엔진, 구동 장치, 센서 고도의 알고리즘도 개발했어요

translation.en: Finally, we added grid fins.
By rotating these fins,
we precisely guide and fly the rocket back to the target.
translation.ko: 로켓을 목표 지점까지 정확하게 운행할 수 있어요

translation.en: At the very last minute,
we light the engines one more time for the landing burn
translation.ko: 엔진을 한 번 더 구동해 착륙을 위한 점화를 해요

translation.en: to slow the rocket all the way down for landing,
hopefully right in the middle of the X.
[officer] Six, five, four, three, two, one, zero.
Liftoff of Falcon 9.
Falcon 9 has cleared the tower.
[man 1] Stage separation confirmed.
[man 2] The first stage is returning to land.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 선체가 지상으로 돌아오고 있습니다

translation.en: -[man 3] Stage one landing burn. -[man 4] Stage one landing burn.
translation.ko: - 선체 1 착륙 점화 - 선체 1 착륙 점화

translation.en: [Lars] Thousands of people worked on the booster landing.
translation.ko: 추진체 착륙 작업에 수천 명의 사람들이 참여했어요

translation.en: Seven years was entirely about getting that booster to land.
When that thing finally came down
and did a picture-perfect landing right on the target,
it's just one of those moments…
…that you will carry for the rest of your life.
-It's standing up. It's standing up. -[man 1] It's standing up.
translation.ko: - 바로 서 있다니 - 꼿꼿이 서 있다!

translation.en: [man 2] Oh my God. [man 3] Look at this. It's just sitting there.
Holy smokes, man.
[Tim] To see them doing this over and over and over
and hitting these bull's-eye targets,
it's just an absolute testament to the… the engineering involved.
[Lori] Elon and SpaceX changed our industry completely.
translation.ko: 일론과 스페이스X가 업계를 완전히 바꿔 놨어요

translation.en: Because everything is reusable,
translation.ko: 모든 걸 재사용할 수 있기 때문에

translation.en: they can now launch for a tenth of the cost that we had,
translation.ko: 10분의 1 비용으로 우주선을 발사할 수 있게 됐어요

translation.en: which saves a lot of tax dollars.
[Jim] Launching in the midst of a coronavirus pandemic,
it's been a challenge.
But we're gonna persevere through this.
We're gonna get Bob and Doug safely to the International Space Station.
translation.ko: 밥과 더그를 안전하게 국제 우주정거장에 보낼 거예요

translation.en: Because this mission to once again launch our astronauts from American soil,
translation.ko: 미국 우주비행사를 미국 땅에서 다시 우주로 보내는 건

translation.en: it's really about hope.
It's about looking up and saying, "Look, we can still do amazing things,
translation.ko: 이전엔 경험하지 못한 어려움이 우리에게 닥쳐와도

translation.en: even when we're being challenged in ways that we've never been challenged before."
translation.ko: 여전히 많은 걸 성취할 수 있다고 하늘을 보며 외치는 것과 같아요

translation.en: Bob and Doug are going into quarantine with their families
in the lead-up to launch day.
This quarantine period is normal for any launch.
translation.ko: 발사를 앞두고 이 정도 격리는 통례적인 거죠

translation.en: Though I guess not much will change for them
since they've been in some form of quarantine since March.
We entered the quarantine period,
so it's hands-off to the rest of the world
until we get back from the International Space Station.
-[woman] How's it look? -Looks good to me.
I'm guessing we're not gonna have this on Space Station, right?
You know, everything that you know and love is down there,
translation.ko: 내가 아는 모든 삶과 사랑하는 이들이 지상에 있는데

translation.en: and you're up here.
And then hopefully everything will work
so I can get back down there, uh, to see 'em again.
translation.ko: 다시 지구에 귀환해 가족을 만날 수 있길 바라면서요

translation.en: Mom, you're walking. I thought we…
translation.ko: 엄마, 왜 걸어요? 같이 뛰는 줄…

translation.en: [woman] I'm gonna catch you.
[Doug] I wanna make sure that I focus on my family,
you know, this being kind of my last opportunity.
Oh yeah, I might be living up there in two weeks.
[Doug] Remember when you saw Mommy on this thing? [boy] Yeah.
translation.ko: - 엄마도 우주선 탔던 거 기억해? - 네

translation.en: [Jim] Probably nobody knows more about what the astronauts are going through,
translation.ko: 우주비행사가 어떤 과정을 겪는지 가장 잘 아는 사람은

translation.en: of course, other than another astronaut.
[Doug] Copy. Oh, nice silhouette on the door.
translation.ko: 오버, 문 앞 실루엣이 맘에 든다

translation.en: Bob and I, you know, we're both married to astronauts.
translation.ko: 밥과 저, 둘 다 우주비행사와 결혼했어요

translation.en: My wife, Karen, she's got two flights.
translation.ko: 제 아내 캐런도 우주 비행을 두 번 했죠

translation.en: [Karen] After my shuttle flight to the space station,
I was not fulfilled completely. I… I wanted more, you know.
translation.ko: 완전히 만족할 수가 없었어요 더 하고 싶었죠

translation.en: And so I went back up there for six months.
[astronaut] Hey, you guys.
-Hey, you guys. Good to see you. -Hey.
[Karen] Every day was varied,
but the main objective was to conduct science
in a zero-gravity environment.
I mean, the station is basically a huge laboratory that's built in space.
translation.ko: 우주정거장은 우주에 만들어진 거대한 연구실과 같아요

translation.en: Any experiments where we interacted with the researchers on the ground,
translation.ko: 실험 결과를 지상의 연구원들과 공유할 때면

translation.en: that was always fun because you could just feel their excitement
and how these experiments help to figure out what's happening on Earth.
translation.ko: 지구의 현상을 이해하는 데 실험 결과가 도움이 되기도 했고요

translation.en: [Doug] Because of the tremendous amount of time Karen was on board the ISS,
translation.ko: 캐런이 국제 우주정거장에 워낙 오래 있었기 때문에

translation.en: there were people years later saying, "Hey, I found your wife's hair up here."
translation.ko: 몇 년 후에도 정거장에서 캐런의 머리카락이 나왔대요

translation.en: I'm like, "Well, well, sorry."
[man] What a beautiful spaceship we're on, guys.
translation.ko: 우리가 이렇게 근사한 우주선을 타고 있어요

translation.en: [Bob] My wife, Megan,
flew on a space shuttle mission to the Hubble Space Telescope.
[Megan] Clear the pin. Five seconds, the mode switch is in auto.
translation.ko: 핀 클리어 5초 후, 자동 모드로 전환

translation.en: -Three, two, one, release. -[beeping]
My mission was the final servicing and repair mission for the telescope.
translation.ko: 제 임무는 마지막으로 망원경을 관리 보수 하는 거였어요

translation.en: We would joke and say, "We're helping to unlock the mysteries of the universe,"
translation.ko: 우주 미스터리 해소를 돕고 있다며 농담하곤 했는데

translation.en: but it really is true.
So whenever I see an article in the paper
where a group of scientists have discovered something new,
translation.ko: 한 무리의 과학자들이 새로운 사실을 발견했다고 하면

translation.en: I always think, you know, "Hey, you helped a little bit with that." [laughs]
[Doug] Before any of us actually got into space,
translation.ko: 우주에 가기 전에는 "나사 우주비행사 후보 2000년 훈련생"

translation.en: Bob and Megan and Karen and I, we were all classmates.
translation.ko: 밥, 메건, 캐런, 저 모두 같은 기수 훈련생이었어요

translation.en: And so we spent a lot of time together.
[news anchor] So far, so good on the ascent of the space shuttle Atlantis
on this its 22nd mission,
the 99th flight in space shuttle history.
[Karen] One of the astronauts from the class ahead of us
translation.ko: 저희보다 먼저 훈련을 마친 우주비행사 중 한 분이

translation.en: hosted a party to celebrate the incoming class,
and I first met Doug at that party.
We were friends first.
It… it took a few years to become more than that, but, um…
translation.ko: 친구 이상의 사이가 된 건 몇 년 후였지만

translation.en: Yeah, I think we were lucky, though, to find each other.
translation.ko: 서로를 만났으니 정말 운이 좋았던 거 같아요

translation.en: [Megan] I remember actually the first time I really heard about Bob.
translation.ko: 처음으로 밥 얘기를 들은 때가 아직도 기억나요

translation.en: We each received kind of this pamphlet
translation.ko: 둘 다 책자 같은 걸 받았는데

translation.en: that showed everyone's picture and, like, a two-sentence bio.
translation.ko: 사람들 사진과 두 줄 소개가 적혀 있었죠

translation.en: He was born in this year, and he graduated in this year,
translation.ko: 어느 해에 태어나 어느 해에 졸업했고

translation.en: and he got a PhD by this year.
translation.ko: 언제 박사 학위를 땄는지 적혀 있었어요

translation.en: He's got to be some kind of, you know, child prodigy.
And he said, "Well, there's actually a typo in there with the dates,"
But I think you'll find that he is a prodigy. [laughs]
translation.ko: 그렇다고 해도 밥이 천재인 건 맞아요

translation.en: [Megan] But over time, I think it became clear that we were gonna build a life together.
translation.ko: 시간이 지나면서 이 사람과 여생을 함께할 거란 확신이 들었죠

translation.en: Had a chance to come out to the old astronaut beach house today.
translation.ko: 유서 깊은 우주비행사 해변 별장에 오게 되었는데요

translation.en: I'm really looking forward to spending some time with my family out here
translation.ko: 며칠 후면 있을 드래건 발사를 앞두고

translation.en: before launching on Dragon in just a few short days.
translation.ko: 가족들과 오붓한 시간을 보내게 되어 정말 기쁘네요

translation.en: [Megan] You know, I think the thing that's most important to us right now
is that we are living every day normally.
We're just enjoying time together as we get closer and closer to launch.
translation.ko: 발사가 다가오고 있지만 함께하는 시간을 즐기고 있어요

translation.en: -[boy] Blastoff! -[rocket whooshing]
Oh, that was our new DM-2 tradition
with our sons to launch rockets from the beach.
-[people cheering] -[Bob] Thank you.
-[Megan] Hey. Bye-bye. -[Bob] Thank you.
-Thank you, guys. -[Megan] Bye-bye.
As we approach liftoff,
I'm just kind of feeling sort of joy tinged with terror,
I guess is the best way that I can describe it.
translation.ko: 이 외에 그때의 심정을 표현할 길이 없네요

translation.en: It's like every other trip, over-packing.

translation.en: There's nothing you can do other than watch,

translation.en: and it's… it's definitely a lot harder.
-None of these I would ever want. -You gonna grow a mustache?

translation.en: [Doug] The best your family can do is break even, right? You come back.

translation.en: -[hairdresser] Never want a what? -Never had a mustache.
translation.ko: - 뭐가 싫다고요? - 아빠도 수염 기른 적 없어

translation.en: I have wrestled with that.
But in the end, ultimately,

translation.en: there are things that are risky,
translation.ko: 살다 보면 세상엔 위험한 일도 있지만

translation.en: but if it results in a better world, maybe it's worth that risk.
translation.ko: 그것이 세상을 이롭게 한다면 감수할 가치가 있다고요

translation.en: [man] So what you're looking at here

We've got three cameras, then what you don't see is the fourth one.

translation.en: -We'll have a jib out here as well. -[Jim] Okay.
They're putting together a Launch America banner

translation.en: Behind that, you'll get a little NASA in there.
translation.ko: 그 뒤로 나사 건물도 살짝 보이고요

translation.en: You'll get a little of the American flag in there as our backdrop.

translation.en: So you got layers of depth to work with, which is kinda nice.

translation.en: And where we go from here is the full dress rehearsal,
translation.ko: 지금부터 전체 드레스 리허설을 할 거예요

translation.en: as if it were live.
[woman] This is the point when the launch escape system is armed,

translation.en: and that happens just before SpaceX begins fueling the Falcon 9 rocket
translation.ko: 스페이스X가 팔콘9 로켓에 연료를 주입하기 직전으로

translation.en: at T-minus 35 minutes.
As a reminder, the purpose…
Right, I'm gonna interrupt Lauren

translation.ko: 발사대에 이례적인 상황이 발생한 듯 보이는데요

translation.en: We have a developing situation with our launch operations.
We've taken a pause
for our NASA and SpaceX teams to gather information.
We are not going away.
We're gonna stay here on this pad shot,
so please stay with us.
Would we really hold on the disaster?
In terms of what, when you say hold?

translation.en: Like, would we just watch it…
Like, if it's a flaming mess, we just watch the rocket explode?
translation.ko: 만약 화재가 발생한다면 가만히 폭발 장면을 보냐고요

translation.en: [man] So depending on when and how it plays itself out,
translation.ko: 언제, 어떤 상황이 발생하느냐에 따라 달라지겠지만

translation.en: we'd probably be cutting to a wide shot
and watching this thing happen.
Can we cut to a control room or something?
translation.ko: 통제실 상황 등을 보여줄 수는 없나요?

translation.en: We couldn't cut away.
-Okay. -Yeah.
Couldn't cut away.
-Uh, we would get… -Hey, look at that.
-[rumbling] -Static fire happening right now.
[Tim] So it looks like they have had successful static fire of the rocket.
translation.ko: 로켓의 정지 점화 테스트는 성공적인 거 같네요

translation.en: That's where they hold the rocket down and actually light up its engines
translation.ko: 로켓을 지상에 고정한 상태에서 엔진을 점화해 보는 거죠

translation.en: to make sure all things are good to go.
And it looks like that has gone smoothly.
This is my sign. This is when I was gonna hit the road,
translation.ko: 신호가 왔네요 지금이 바로 제가 움직일 때거든요

translation.en: because that means they're still on track to actually be launching here.
I have to pack masks. It's a freaking pandemic.
This is the actual warning label,
like on the International Space Station, the hatches.
translation.ko: 국제 우주정거장 해치에 붙어 있는 거예요

translation.en: I mean, even space underwear.
I am… I'm a nerd.
Now, with humans flying, starting to get a little… a little nervousness
because I have watched rockets fail.
translation.ko: 로켓 발사가 늘 성공하는 건 아니니까요

translation.en: Just today, Virgin Orbit had their first orbital launch attempt,
translation.ko: 오늘만 해도 버진 오빗이 첫 궤도체 발사를 시도했는데

translation.en: and it failed.
And it sucks. Space is hard.
There's still so many moving parts,
and there's so many things that can go wrong.
And, of course, I have a lot of confidence in the systems,
but it… There is a real sense of… of importance.
There's a real sense of danger now.
It's getting a lot more real now.
[man 1 over speaker] With primary day tomorrow,
it's looking a little wishy-washy.
Um, all the models are showing some isolated storms
translation.ko: 모든 모델에서 국지성 뇌우가 관찰되고 있어요

translation.en: just west of the staging area that--
[man 2] Yeah, you can see the map. That's the front approaching.
translation.ko: 네, 지도를 보시면 됩니다 전면으로 접근 중이고요

translation.en: Looks pretty scary.
The, uh, risk for, uh, the launch corridor went up to 47%,
in the high category.
I was gonna suggest maybe Ben, since he compiled this,
what would be his recommendation?
[Ben] Looking at just wind and waves at this point,
I… I feel like it's within a risk level that we would accept.
translation.ko: 우리가 수용할 수 있는 위험 범위 안에 있긴 하지만

translation.en: Um, but based on the… the rain, the lightning,
it's driving the numbers quite a bit higher.
[Bala] Weather is very, you know, fickle in Florida.
Some of the most intense lightning I've seen in the world
translation.ko: 세계 어디에서도 본 적 없는 가장 무시무시한 번개가

translation.en: happens at Cape Canaveral.
My job, at the end of the day,
is to make sure that the risk is acceptable
translation.ko: 위험도가 우리가 감수할 만한 수준인지 확인하고

translation.en: and give the final go-ahead for the mission.
I basically have to have nerves of steel. [laughs]
It's terrifying when you, like, say, like, "Yeah, go for launch."
translation.ko: 발사를 승인할 때마다 정말 너무 무섭거든요

translation.en: [Ben] It's gonna be right on the edge, probably.
We got to be crisp on this thing going forward.
translation.ko: 지금부터 다들 정신 바짝 차려야 할 거예요

translation.en: [Doug] Thunderstorms are such a big issue

translation.ko: 찰나의 순간에 우주정거장을 향해 발사해야 하거든요

translation.en: Basically, we have to wait for the Earth to rotate

Any problems it's like, "Oh, we're scrubbed."
translation.ko: 문제가 발생하면 그 순간 망한 거죠

translation.en: You know, "We're not gonna go fly."
translation.ko: 아무 데도 갈 수 없게 돼요

translation.en: [Bala] In addition to all those weather factors,
one of the most nerve-racking moments

translation.ko: 우주비행사들이 탄 상태에서 연료를 채울 때예요

translation.en: We're basically loading, like, a million pounds of, like, fuel and oxygen
into this big tank, and the astronauts are sitting on top.
translation.ko: 커다란 탱크 위에 우주비행사들이 앉아 있거든요

translation.en: A rocket is an energetic system,

translation.ko: 작은 유출도 커다란 참사로 이어질 수 있죠

translation.en: We have had an incident in the past…
[Hans] We destroyed the satellite, we destroyed the rocket,

translation.ko: 진상을 파악하는 데만 몇 달이 걸렸어요

translation.en: The rocket blew up, but it was not caused by the fueling process, per se.
translation.ko: 로켓이 폭발한 건 연료 주입 과정 때문이 아니라

translation.en: It was caused by a pressure tank.
I didn't expect it to fail that traumatic.
translation.ko: 그렇게 큰 사고가 나며 실패할 줄 몰랐어요

translation.en: When you work on this, you really hope it works.

translation.en: [Elon] I'm cautiously optimistic about tomorrow.
translation.ko: 조심스럽긴 하지만 내일 잘될 거 같아요

translation.en: There's nothing more we can think of to improve the probability of success.
translation.ko: 성공 확률을 높이기 위해 할 수 있는 건 다 했으니까요

translation.en: But I don't wanna tempt fate.
There's always things you don't know about,
translation.ko: 간과한 부분이 있을 거예요 그 부분이 언제 터질지는 아무도 모르는 거고요

translation.en: so you don't know when those are gonna come and get you.
translation.ko: 그 부분이 언제 터질지는 아무도 모르는 거고요

translation.en: Making sure Bob and Doug are safe is not simply our first priority.
translation.ko: 밥과 더그의 안전 보장은 가장 중요한 게 아니라

translation.en: It is our only priority.
[Jim] So at the top of the hour,

translation.en: But remember, thunderstorms down here in Florida are generally isolated,

translation.en: and so just because there's thunderstorms on the horizon

I'm more optimistic than pessimistic,
translation.ko: 전 좀 더 낙관적인 쪽으로 기운 상태이긴 하지만

translation.en: but we're gonna get one last look at the top of the hour.
translation.ko: 정각이 되면 마지막으로 한 번 더 상황을 살피겠습니다

translation.en: [cameraman] Thank you, sir.
-Have a great launch. -[Jim] My pleasure. Thank you.
-Hey, this is huge. -[cameraman] We got more down there.
translation.ko: - 이거 엄청 크네요 - 여기 더 있어요

translation.en: Gets me through the day. -[cameraman laughs] -I'm very grateful.

translation.en: [Hans] It's not too bad.
I mean…
…it's a mess, but at least it's… It has a chance to clear up.
translation.ko: 상황이 좋진 않은데 날씨가 갤 수도 있겠어요

translation.en: [Jim] The big thing right now is isolated thunderstorms.

translation.en: The question is, is it gonna be sufficiently problematic

translation.en: to where we… we can't launch?
Um, right now, I'm being told fifty-fifty.
Hi, it's me, Tim Dodd, the Everyday Astronaut.

translation.en: The weather is starting to clear up here a little bit,

translation.ko: 이번 발사가 올해 놓쳐선 안 될 행사인 건 확실해 보이는데요

translation.en: Now, just waiting to hear what's gonna happen.
My name is Jessie Anderson.
translation.ko: "미국을 하늘 위로 더그 헐리 - 밥 벵컨" 제 이름은 제시 앤더슨입니다

translation.en: I'm a lead manufacturing engineer here at SpaceX,

translation.en: to finally be sending humans to the International Space Station.
It's a great day.
Today's mission is known as Demonstration Mission-2.
It's gonna be the first time a commercially built spacecraft
translation.ko: 사상 최초로 상업 부문에서 제작한 우주선에

translation.en: will launch people to the space station.
Demo-2 is an end-to-end flight test,

And it's the final test for NASA to certify SpaceX

translation.ko: 우주비행사 정기 수송선으로 인증하기 전 마지막 관문이죠

translation.en: [Gwynne] I don't get nervous for launches.

translation.en: Starting a month ago or so, I started getting nervous for this launch.

translation.en: Hard to get any work done at all today.

translation.en: Launch makes you superstitious.

translation.en: I think it's an Air Force term actually, but people do very odd things.

translation.en: [Hans] I don't look at the mission sticker.

translation.ko: - 진짜요? - 빨간 옷 입으면 못 떠요

translation.en: Wearing green would be extra good luck.

translation.en: [Bala] Why is that?
Just so that we can launch on the third day.
[Gwynne] I was in Scotland for the first time we got to orbit,

[man] Are you a very superstitious person?

I think we've pounded flat the risks that we understand

translation.en: and the risks we know about,

translation.ko: 안전하게 우주정거장에 데려갈 수 있으면 좋겠고

translation.en: and inspire generations to come.
Really, we just can't fuck it up. [laughs]
That's the most important thing about today.
No fucking it up.
[Jim] This is my second one.
That was my first. So I don't know, is that like three? I don't know.
translation.ko: 처음엔 저걸 마신 거 같은데 3개인가요? 모르겠네요

translation.en: [man 1] Okay, Jim, we have the, uh, official weather update.

-So we're go for launch. -[Jim] Fantastic.
-So we're gonna head over. -[man 2] Yes.
Big day, sir.
-[Jim] It is. -[man 1] Yeah, it is.
[Jim] I think anybody who's been involved in this for the last decade
translation.ko: 지난 10년간 이 작업에 참여해 온 모두가

translation.en: has got to be on the edge of their seat right now.
translation.ko: 지금 제대로 앉아 있지도 못할 거예요

translation.en: This agency has had many, many tough times in the past…

translation.ko: 오늘 밥과 더그가 탑승할 로켓 발사를 위해

translation.en: we've done everything we can.
There comes that moment when you say, "Okay, now is the time."
translation.ko: 드디어 대면해야 할 결전의 순간이 온 거예요

translation.en: [Jessie] Here they come, NASA astronauts Bob Behnken and Doug Hurley.
translation.ko: 저기 오네요 나사 우주비행사 밥 벵컨과 더그 헐리입니다

translation.en: They've each made this journey twice before.
translation.ko: 두 사람 모두 두 번씩 우주정거장에 다녀왔는데요

translation.en: [male host] There's Megan and Karen and their sons.
-I love you. -[boy] I love you, Dad.
Here's my big hug. Here comes the big hug.
Oh, squeeze.
[Doug] When you're saying goodbye to your family, you really realize

translation.ko: 로켓이 우주에 가는 게 다가 아니란 걸 깨달아요

translation.en: That there's… There can be consequences.
translation.ko: 엄청난 대가를 치를 수도 있단 걸 새삼 느끼죠

translation.en: [Bob] To see your parent launch on the rocket,

The first time we shared it with him,
translation.ko: 처음 아이에게 이 얘기를 했을 때

translation.en: his opinion was, you know, "Daddy can't go to space."
That's something I wasn't quite, uh, prepared for.
translation.ko: 그런 상황엔 준비가 안 돼 있었어요

translation.en: I didn't expect to… to have that hit me as much as it did.
[woman] And we are following the convoy

These people have been working long hours.
Coronavirus happened, and we made it.
And here they come.
Just minutes from now, the astronauts will climb into Dragon.
translation.ko: 몇 분 후면 우주비행사들이 드래건에 탑승합니다

translation.en: [man] It's a beautiful view up there, too,

[technician] We're gonna make sure all your zippers are closed,
minus your gloves.
Good?
[man 1] Does it feel like this line is gonna move?

translation.ko: - 그러면 여기도 움직일 텐데 - 이 뒤에 건 가라앉을 거예요

translation.en: -Okay. -[man 2] Probably a couple hours.
translation.ko: - 알았어요 - 2시간 정도면 되겠죠 "키코 돈트체프, 스페이스X 발사 및 회수, 시니어 디렉터"

translation.en: I think if we can get Elon here. I just wanna make sure he's in the loop.

Yeah, great, but who at the Range?
