They're the ones that basically make the call on the Range weather.
translation.ko: 기지 날씨 관련해 모든 걸 결정해요

translation.en: Mike's gonna call it right now.
[Mike] Dragon, SpaceX. Weather is go at this time.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 발사 허가가 떨어졌다

translation.en: Dragon copy. Go weather.
translation.ko: 여기는 드래건 알았다, 날씨가 큰일 했네

translation.en: [Mike] Dragon, SpaceX. You are go for section seven.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 섹션 7 허가가 떨어졌다

translation.en: Close visors and arm launch escape system.
translation.ko: 안면 보호대를 내리고 발사체 탈출 시스템을 가동하도록

translation.en: Visors coming closed.
7.2, our visors are closed, and we're arming the launch escape system.
translation.ko: 7.2, 안면 보호대 차단 완료 발사체 탈출 시스템 가동 시작

translation.en: [officer 1] Launch escape system is verified armed.
[launch director] Launch director to countdown net, poll is complete,
translation.ko: 카운트다운 네트, 발사 디렉터다 마지막 점검을 완료했고

translation.en: and we have a go to proceed with propellant load.
[officer 2] Propellant load has started.
[launch director] Dragon, SpaceX launch director.
2D to violate a couple of weather rules
translation.ko: 날씨 위반 사항이 두 개 발생했다

translation.en: that now do not expect to clear in time for launch.
translation.ko: 발사 시간에 맞춰 해결되지 않을 듯하다

translation.en: Proceed to 2D launch abort sequence, please.
[Bob] We copy. We can see some raindrops on the windows,
and it's just part of the deal.
[Mike] Copy all.
[Kiko] That's it.
-It's aborted? -[Kiko] Yeah.
It's not our day.
Basically, we've got ten major weather rules,
and three of them are in violation right now.
-Three? -Yeah.
At least eyeballing it, this does not look like we should be stopping launch.
translation.ko: 눈대중으로 봤을 땐 발사해도 될 거 같은데요

translation.en: We wanna make sure
we're not scrubbing based on half-hour-old weather.
translation.ko: 30분 전 날씨 때문에 중단해서는 안 되잖아요

translation.en: [man] The measurement's real-time… it's real-time lightning.
-[Elon] Okay. -[man] Yeah.
We just wanna make sure it's real and we're not jumping at shadows.
translation.ko: 지레 겁먹은 건 아닌지 확실하게 해 두고 싶어서요

translation.en: Okay.
[Kiko] So next launch time is Saturday.
[Elon] Okay.
[Kiko] I… am bummed.
-[chuckling] Yes, I am bummed too. -[Kiko laughing]
I, too, am bummed. Yes.
I am too.
[Mike] Dragon, SpaceX. Thanks for the valiant effort today.
translation.ko: 드레건, 여기는 스페이스X 오늘 용기를 보여줘서 감사하고

translation.en: Appreciate your resilience.
[Doug] Yeah, we appreciate those words.
Everybody did great today, and we'll do it again on Saturday.
translation.ko: 오늘 모두 정말 잘했고 토요일에 다시 시도하도록 하겠다

translation.en: [woman] Today, we're giving it another shot.
Wednesday's first attempt was postponed due to that wild weather,
translation.ko: 수요일에 있었던 첫 시도는 악천후로 연기되었는데요

translation.en: but if all goes well today, we will mark a new first
translation.ko: 오늘 모든 게 잘 진행되면 최초의 역사를 쓰는 동시에

translation.en: and usher in the commercial-crew era of American spaceflight.
translation.ko: 미국 우주 비행 역사에 상업 우주선 시대가 도래합니다

translation.en: [Doug] To get an actual scrub, it really was almost like a gift.
translation.ko: 첫 시도가 중단된 게 선물같이 느껴지기도 했어요

translation.en: It was just one last chance
to go through and evaluate and make sure everything's ready to fly.
translation.ko: 비행 준비가 잘됐는지 모든 걸 확인할 기회를 얻은 거죠

translation.en: But from an emotional standpoint, it was extremely difficult.
My son, Jack, was really hit pretty hard when we scrubbed.
translation.ko: 제 아들 잭도 중단 이후 굉장히 힘들어했어요

translation.en: Karen said he kind of went and sat in a chair
translation.ko: 아내 말이 애가 의자에 가만히 앉아 있었대요

translation.en: and just wanted to be by himself.
He kind of gets that there's a lot that can go wrong.
translation.ko: 아이도 일이 여러 방식으로 잘못될 수 있다는 걸 아는 거죠

translation.en: He had already said goodbye to me,
and I… I think he probably didn't wanna have to go through that again.
translation.ko: 그런 상황을 또 맞이하는 게 어려웠을 거예요

translation.en: Hey, buddy, I love you.
You bet. This is gonna be cool.
Be good for Mommy.
See you, buddy.
[Bob] Hey, Theo, you be on good behavior, okay?
translation.ko: 테오, 말 잘 듣고 있어 알았지?

translation.en: And enjoy today. Watch the rocket for me, okay?
translation.ko: 오늘 즐겁게 보내 아빠 생각하며 로켓 보고, 알았지?

translation.en: I'll call you from the space station.
Okay, you're welcome.
I love you.
To see your parent launch on a rocket
translation.ko: 제 아들은 아직 아빠가 로켓을 타고 우주에 가는 걸

translation.en: is something that my son hasn't been exposed to.
I needed to figure out a way to prepare him for that.
translation.ko: 아이가 마음의 준비를 할 수 있는 방법을 생각해 내야 했어요

translation.en: This is, uh, Tremor.
Tremor is, uh… was actually my son's dinosaur.
translation.ko: 사실 트레머는 제 아들의 공룡 장난감인데요

translation.en: I decided to bring Tremor and take him through the entire process,
translation.ko: 트레머를 데리고 와 전 과정을 함께하기로 했어요

translation.en: you know, to make it feel a little bit more normal for my son.
translation.ko: 아들이 조금이라도 더 편히 상황을 받아들일 수 있게요

translation.en: [officer 1] Core and countdown one in T-minus 2 hours and 46 minutes.
The crew has arrived at the White Room. Its ingress is in progress on schedule.
translation.ko: 대원들이 화이트 룸에 도착했고 예정대로 탑승 중이다

translation.en: [launch director] Launch Control, clear to retract the axis arm on time.
translation.ko: 여기는 발사 통제실 예정대로 공중 통로를 철회하도록

translation.en: Crew access arm retract has started.
translation.ko: 대원 접근용 공중 통로 철회를 시작한다

translation.en: [launch director] Launch director to countdown net, poll is complete,
translation.ko: 카운트다운 네트, 발사 디렉터다 마지막 점검을 완료했고

translation.en: and we have a go to proceed with propellant load.
[officer 2] Copy.
[Kiko] What's up, Elon?
Looking a little nicer today.
translation.ko: 오늘은 상황이 좀 나은 거 같네요

translation.en: [Elon] It looks really nice.
-Oh, palo santo. -[Elon] Yeah.
Like it. Anything you can do. [chuckles]
It's for good luck.
Situations like this, you can't have too much luck.
translation.ko: 지금 같은 상황엔 온갖 행운을 끌어모아야죠

translation.en: [man] You believe in luck?
[Elon] I believe luck is the best superpower.
If you can have any superpower, luck is the one you'd want.
translation.ko: 초능력을 가질 수 있다면 행운을 갖는 게 최고예요

translation.en: [officer 3] Propellant fills are complete.
Falcon 9 is in startup. Dragon is in countdown.
translation.ko: 팔콘 9은 가동 중이고 드래건은 카운트다운 중이다

translation.en: FTS is armed for launch.
All right.
Holy shit, here we go.
-Here we go. -[Elon sighs]
[launch director] Dragon, SpaceX. Go for launch.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 발사 허가가 떨어졌다

translation.en: SpaceX, Dragon. We're go for launch. Let's light this candle.
translation.ko: 스페이스X, 여기는 드래건 우린 준비 끝났다, 점화해도 좋다

translation.en: [officer 4] Ten, nine, eight, seven, six,
five, four, three, two, one, zero.
-Ignition. Liftoff. -[rumbling]
-It's going. -Here we go.
Stage one propulsion is nominal.
Falcon power telemetry nominal.
translation.ko: 팔콘 전력 원격 측정 상태 정상

translation.en: We're monitoring.
[officer] Vehicle is supersonic and passing through maximum dynamic pressure.
translation.ko: 현재 초음속 상태로 최대 동압을 지나고 있습니다

translation.en: [Bob] Copy one bravo.
[launch director] And 1D throttle down.
[Doug] Throttling down the Merlin engines.
[Kiko] Standing by for separation.
Dragon copy.
[officer] Stage separation confirmed.
[Kiko] First stage has done its job.
Switch over to the second.
Second stage ignited.
[Bob] SpaceX, Dragon. Thanks for the great ride to space.
translation.ko: 스페이스X, 여기는 드래건 우주에 안전하게 보내줘서 고맙다

translation.en: Congratulations. We just put… we just put astronauts in orbit.
translation.ko: 축하해요, 우리가 방금 우주비행사를 궤도에 올렸어요

translation.en: -Incredible. -Yeah!
Yeah.
Well-done, guys.
-Good work. -[man] That's awesome.
Congrats hug.
That's real, dude. That's space!
[Elon] Wow. It only takes nine minutes to get to orbit.
translation.ko: 지구 궤도에 가는 데 9분밖에 안 걸려요

translation.en: Nine minutes, and you're going 25 times the speed of sound.
Bob and Doug--
[Elon] Bob and Doug are cool as cucumbers.
[Kiko] Just hanging out. It looks too smooth.
translation.ko: 그냥 노는 거 같아요 정말 자연스럽네요

translation.en: [Kiko] Two dads.
Dads in space.
[Doug] Well, everyone, kind of a tradition we've had with spacecraft,
translation.ko: 여러분, 우주선엔 수성 시대부터 이어져 온

translation.en: going way back to the Mercury era.
We're given the honor to name this capsule.
translation.ko: 이 캡슐의 이름을 저희가 짓는 거죠

translation.en: Without further ado,
we would like to, uh, welcome you aboard Capsule Endeavour.
[Bob] Uh, I'll tell you that for the ride uphill,
while it was a… an exciting ride,
I think we got a… a couple of surprises
just in terms of the way the vehicle is kind of moving
and… and shaking and taking you into orbit.
translation.ko: 궤도에 진입하면서 흔들리는 형태 등에 좀 놀랐어요

translation.en: You can tell that it's, uh…
It's fighting against the Earth as it makes its way into space.
translation.ko: 우주선이 우주로 진입하면서 지구와 싸우는 듯했어요

translation.en: We did, it turns out, end up with one stowaway
translation.ko: 그리고 알고 봤더니 오늘 발사 과정에서

translation.en: on board our, uh, vehicle when we launched today.
translation.ko: 우주선에 몰래 탄 밀항자가 한 명 있었네요

translation.en: I hope both of our sons were super excited to see, uh, their toy
floating around with us on board.
I'm sure they would rather be here, given the opportunity,
translation.ko: 물론 기회가 있다면 직접 우주선에 타고 싶겠지만

translation.en: but hopefully, they're proud of this as well.
[Doug] So with that, I think it'll be good night from Capsule Endeavour.
translation.ko: 그럼 이제 캡슐 인데버는 잠자리에 들도록 하겠습니다

translation.en: Good night, Megan and Theo.
And Karen and Jack.
[Elon] Thank you. Congratulations.
[Jim] We can breathe another sigh of relief. [Elon] Indeed.
[cameraman] You're good there?
-He's left of the pole? Yeah? -[man] I gotcha.
[Jim] So far, everything has performed very, very well,
and we are excited that Bob and Doug are safely in orbit
and on the way to the International Space Station.
translation.ko: 국제 우주정거장을 향하고 있어서 정말 기뻐요

translation.en: [reporter 1] Elon, what would you say to those who doubted SpaceX could do this?
translation.ko: 스페이스X의 성공을 의심한 많은 이에게 할 말은 없나요?

translation.en: Do you have a message for them?
Do I have a message for those who…
-What? -[Jim] Who doubted you.
Oh, doubted. Okay. I was like, "What did he--?" Okay. Um…
translation.ko: 아, 저를 의심한 사람들요 무슨 말인지 못 알아들었어요

translation.en: Maybe I just blank out the word "doubt."
No, I mean, I… To be totally frank, I doubted us too.
When starting SpaceX, I thought we maybe had a 10% chance of reaching orbit.
translation.ko: 처음엔 궤도 비행 성공 가능성이 10% 정도라고 생각했거든요

translation.en: But fortunately, fate has smiled upon us and brought us to this day.
translation.ko: 하지만 감사하게도 운이 좋았고 여기까지 왔네요

translation.en: [reporter 2] Elon, you said that you had told Bob and Doug's boys
translation.ko: 밥과 더그의 자녀들에게 두 사람의 무사 귀환을 위해

translation.en: that you'd do everything you can to bring them home safely.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 모든 걸 하겠다고 약속했다 하셨는데요

translation.en: Even with a safe launch out of the way, that must still weigh on you,
translation.ko: 물론 발사는 무사히 마쳤지만 귀환 문제가 걱정될 거 같은데

translation.en: and I wondered what it's like as a dad.
translation.ko: 같은 아빠로서 이에 대해 한마디 해 주시죠

translation.en: So, you know, uh, there's still…
We still gotta dock with Space Station. We still gotta, uh… still gotta return.
translation.ko: 우주정거장에 도킹도 해야 하고 지구로 귀환도 해야 해요

translation.en: I think there's an argument that
the return is more… more dangerous in some ways than the ascent.
translation.ko: 귀환 여정이 더 위험하다고 말하는 분들도 있죠

translation.en: So we don't wanna declare victory yet.
translation.ko: 그러니 아직 성공을 장담할 수는 없어요

translation.en: Anyway… I'm getting choked up here, so…
It… It's… Really, this…
Yeah, I don't… I'm getting choked up. Sorry.
I'm not sure I can answer the question any more than that except, um…
translation.ko: 그 질문에 이 말 외에는 할 수 있는 말이 없어요

translation.en: Yeah, we're gonna do everything we can to make sure it gets home safely.
translation.ko: 두 사람의 무사 귀환을 위해 할 수 있는 모든 걸 할 거라고요

translation.en: [Doug] Well, good morning, everyone, from, uh, Endeavour.
We, uh, had a great night. Got to get a little sleep.
translation.ko: 저희는 밤새 잘 있었어요 잠도 좀 잤고요

translation.en: And, uh, as you can see, a beautiful day pass right now.
translation.ko: 보시다시피 아름다운 주간 지역을 지나고 있습니다

translation.en: Getting pretty close to ISS,
uh, as we're flying at about 17,500 miles an hour
around the planet.
[woman] Dragon, SpaceX. Comm check on big loop.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 전체 통신 채널 상태를 확인한다

translation.en: [Doug] SpaceX, Dragon. Loud and clear now on the big loop.
translation.ko: 스페이스X, 여기는 드래건 전체 채널 통신 잘 들린다

translation.en: Good morning, Anna.
[Anna] Good morning. Great to hear your voice.
[Doug] It's great to hear yours as well.
We're looking forward to rendezvousing with Space Station today.
[Anna] I am responsible for being Bob and Doug's eyes and ears on the ground
translation.ko: "애나 메논, 스페이스X 미션 관제탑 스페셜리스트" 밥과 더그가 국제 우주정거장에 도착해서 도킹하는 동안

translation.en: as they approach and then dock with the International Space Station.
translation.ko: 제가 지상에서 두 사람의 눈과 귀가 되어야 해요

translation.en: My role is to help make sure that they are informed
translation.ko: 잘못된 일이 있거나 할 때 두 사람에게 알리는 게

translation.en: of anything that's going awry,
and I am forever grateful to be a part of this moment.
translation.ko: 이런 순간에 함께할 수 있다니 평생 감사할 거예요

translation.en: One of my fourth-grade teachers was actually the daughter
of one of the astronauts on the Challenger.
She brought our class to NASA,
translation.ko: 그 선생님이 저희들에게 나사 견학을 시켜주셨어요

translation.en: and from that time on, I knew I wanted to be
a part of space operations.
translation.ko: 우주 미션에 관련된 일을 하고 싶었죠

translation.en: I still am amazed by how she… she ultimately changed my life,
and I imagine that she changed many other people's lives
translation.ko: 그 때문에 제 인생이 바뀌었다니 놀라울 따름이에요

translation.en: as a result of something
that had to have been incredibly painful for her.
translation.ko: 아마 다른 학생들의 삶도 선생님 덕분에 바뀌었을 거예요

translation.en: Dragon, SpaceX.
Your rendezvous complete time is expected to be 1050 UTC.
translation.ko: 오늘 접촉은 협정세계시 기준 10시 50분에 완료될 예정이다

translation.en: [Bob] Copy.
[Anna] As Dragon is approaching the space station,
it's flying at incredible speeds.
It first does a series of burns
translation.ko: 처음엔 여러 번에 걸쳐 점화를 해요

translation.en: to get it in close proximity to the space station
until the point at which it is basically in a straight line
translation.ko: 이 과정은 도킹 어댑터와 일직선을 이룰 때까지

translation.en: towards the docking adapter.
The whole time, we are watching our telemetry
translation.ko: 이 과정 내내 저희는 원격 측정기를 확인해요

translation.en: and making sure that when it gets to the docking adapter,
it is precisely where it needs to be.
One problem, and it's a collision.
We face that risk, and we deal with that
by being extremely intentional in everything we do.
translation.ko: 모든 일에 극도로 세심한 주의를 기울일 수밖에 없어요

translation.en: [man] Space Station on the big loop.
translation.ko: 여기는 우주정거장 전체 통신 채널로 말한다

translation.en: Dragon, tally ho. I know you guys probably see it on the video cameras,
translation.ko: 드래건, 대박이다 카메라 영상으로 보고 있겠지만

translation.en: but with the naked eye, we can see it as well.
Looking like a nice, shiny new friend.
translation.ko: 새 친구가 빛나는 자태를 뽐내고 있다

translation.en: Dragon copies. We'll be there in a second.
[Anna] Dragon, SpaceX.
Ground is go for approach initiation.
[Doug] Dragon on the big loop. We copy go.
[officer] Dragon, just 400 meters directly below station,
translation.ko: 드래건이 정거장 바로 밑 400m 거리에 위치 중이다

translation.en: swinging itself up out in front to align itself with the docking adapter.
translation.ko: 도킹 어댑터와 일직선을 이루려 위쪽으로 이동해 정면에 위치했다

translation.en: [Anna] Dragon, SpaceX. Commanding hold.
[Doug] Copy. We will command the hold.
[officer] Dragon holding a little over 17,000 miles an hour,
directly out in front of the space station.
[man] Space Station on the big loop.
translation.ko: 여기는 우주정거장 전체 통신 채널로 말한다

translation.en: Crew on the International Space Station is ready for docking.
translation.ko: 국제 우주정거장의 대원들은 도킹 준비를 마쳤다

translation.en: [Anna] Dragon, SpaceX. You are go to execute final approach.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 최종 접근 실행을 허가한다

translation.en: [Doug] Copy. Go for docking.
[Anna] We are following along with you.
[Doug] One hundred meters away from the space station.
[Anna] You know, as we were approaching the space station,
I remember being extremely focused.
I had a checklist in my mind.
[Bob] We're inside 20 meters.
[Anna] And I remember at one point, we were close to docking,
and I looked up, and I saw Dragon.
translation.ko: 도킹 직전에 위를 올려다봤는데 드래건이 보였던 것도 기억나요

translation.en: I just had this moment of almost pinching myself
translation.ko: 이런 광경이 펼쳐지고 있다는 게 믿기지 않아서

translation.en: that… that I couldn't believe this was happening.
I told myself this is… this is an incredibly special moment.
translation.ko: 이게 얼마나 특별한 순간인지 마음속에 각인했어요

translation.en: [Bob] Three meters to go.
Two meters.
We are inside the hands-off point. One meter to go.
[Anna] Dragon, SpaceX. Docking sequence is complete.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 도킹 시퀀스가 완료됐다

translation.en: Welcome to the International Space Station.
[man] Dragon arriving.
The crew of Expedition 63 is honored to welcome
Dragon and the commercial crew program aboard the International Space Station.
translation.ko: 국제 우주정거장 승선을 영광으로 생각하고 환영한다

translation.en: Bob and Doug, glad to have you as part of the crew.
translation.ko: 밥, 더그 함께하게 되어 정말 기뻐요

translation.en: [officer] Aboard the International Space Station,
Commander Chris Cassidy standing by in node two.
translation.ko: 사령관 크리스 캐시디가 2번 노드에 서 있네요

translation.en: He does have two crew members on board,
translation.ko: 두 명의 대원이 함께 타 있는데

translation.en: both Russian cosmonauts.
He, uh, recently launched on the same Russian Soyuz spacecraft
translation.ko: 크리스는 동일한 러시아 소유스호를 타고 왔는데

translation.en: just a little more than a month ago.
translation.ko: 온 지 이제 한 달 좀 넘었다고 합니다

translation.en: [Chris] And with that, Endeavour, welcome to the International Space Station.
translation.ko: 이제 됐네요, 인데버 국제 우주정거장에 온 걸 환영해요

translation.en: Please come aboard.
[Jim] Station, this is the NASA Administrator. Can you hear me?
translation.ko: 정거장, 나사 국장입니다 제 목소리 들리시나요?

translation.en: We hear you loud and clear, sir.
Welcome to the space station.
[Jim] Thank you, Chris. It's good to see you.
And welcome to Bob and Doug.
I will tell you, the whole world saw this mission,
translation.ko: 정말이지 전 세계가 이번 미션을 지켜봤어요

translation.en: and we are so, so proud.
I have a… a question for Chris.
Our crew here decided to be about three days late.
You gotta work them overtime, I presume now,
translation.ko: 아무래도 초과 근무를 해야 하지 않을까 싶네요

translation.en: to get them caught up on all the activities that they missed out on.
Well, the day they missed out on was a good one for them to skip.
translation.ko: 사실 땡땡이치기 딱 좋은 임무들을 놓쳤어요

translation.en: It was Saturday housecleaning, and I…
But I took care of it for 'em. We'll catch up next… next weekend.
translation.ko: 제가 다 해 놨으니 다음 주말에나 하면 될 거 같아요

translation.en: Uh, but in all seriousness,
we're looking forward to some operational stuff later in the month.
translation.ko: 이번 달 말에 설비 관련 업무가 있을 예정인데

translation.en: Maybe we'll get outside and do some space walks.
translation.ko: 밖에 나가서 유영을 하게 될지도 몰라요

translation.en: So we're… we're all super excited to have two more crewmates
translation.ko: 그런 상황에서 탐험대 63에 팀원이 두 명이나 더 생겨서

translation.en: to the Expedition 63 team.
[man] Station, this is James Corden with the CBS Late Late Show.
translation.ko: 정거장, CBS '레이트 레이트 쇼' 진행자 제임스 코든입니다

translation.en: How are you, gentlemen? Can you hear me?
translation.ko: 다들 어떻게 지내세요? 제 말 들리세요?

translation.en: James.
Welcome aboard the International Space Station.
We heard you loud and clear.
[James] How are you getting on up there? How are you doing? Are you okay?
translation.ko: 위에서 어떻게 지내고 계세요? 컨디션은 어떠세요? 괜찮으세요?

translation.en: [Doug] We're doing pretty good.
I think we're assimilating into the, uh, ISS life,
trying to help Chris out as much as we can.
[James] That's great. I'm jealous of both of you right now
translation.ko: 잘됐네요 두 분 모두 부러워 죽겠어요

translation.en: because I've spent most of my life wanting to be weightless.
translation.ko: 제 평생 꿈이 몸무게에 안 짓눌려 보는 거거든요

translation.en: Tell me, what's the best and worst thing
about living life in zero gravity every day?
Oh, look at this.
That's magnificent.
[Doug] You can imagine that there's a lot of places,
like going to the restroom, for example,
where you like stuff to stay where you put it.
And so, uh, we definitely find that frustrating at times.
Time to go.
You take the valve, and, uh…
That's where your business goes.
[Doug] They have six crew quarters on board the space station,
and those crew quarters are really, really nice.
You've got your laptop in there.
You've got your sleeping bag attached to a wall.
[interviewer] Can you reach down and touch your toes?
translation.ko: 허리를 숙여서 발가락을 만질 수 있나요?

translation.en: You probably would have to fold your computer up,
and then you might be able to kind of do a sit-up,
translation.ko: 다음에 윗몸일으키기 동작을 하면 되지 않을까요?

translation.en: uh, and not hit both walls.
I mean, it's certainly not huge,
but it's actually kind of…
kind of cozy, if… if I had to be honest.
[woman] What kind of liquids can you drink?
Is there a cocktail hour in space?
Every hour is cocktail hour for, uh…
translation.ko: 매 시간 칵테일을 마시는 거나 마찬가지예요

translation.en: for astronauts.
Because you can drink balls of fluid right out of the air like that.
translation.ko: 공중에 떠 있는 공 모양의 액체를 마실 수 있으니까요

translation.en: I don't know how many of these examples I wanna set for my son,
translation.ko: 아들을 생각하면 이런 행동이 좀 걱정되네요

translation.en: because he'll be playing with his food all day
if he gets the chance to see something like this.
translation.ko: 종일 음식을 갖고 놀려고 할 테니까요

translation.en: Chicken.
[Doug] We exercise for about two hours, uh, every day,
with weight lifting and either running or cycling
to maintain our health and our fitness for our return.
[Bob] Our heart,
its most important job is to feed the brain oxygenated blood.
translation.ko: 산소를 함량한 혈액을 뇌에 공급하는 거예요

translation.en: And then when you take the gravity vector out of the picture,
the heart sends too much up to the brain, and your head gets all puffed up.
translation.ko: 심장이 뇌에 과다 혈액을 공급해 뇌가 부풀어 오르게 되죠

translation.en: [Karen] The way your body adapts to weightlessness,
I distinctly remember when I first got to space,
translation.ko: 우주에 처음 갔을 때가 아직도 생생히 기억나요

translation.en: every time I would flip upside down, I felt like I was upside down.
translation.ko: 몸을 아무리 뒤집어도 계속 거꾸로인 느낌이 들었죠

translation.en: And there was a moment
where I was trying to hang my sleeping bag on the mid-deck wall,
translation.ko: 중앙 조종실 벽에 침낭을 걸려고 했는데

translation.en: and, just like this, my mind completely changed.
And from that point on, I could be in any orientation,
translation.ko: 그때부터 어느 방향으로든 생활할 수 있었어요

translation.en: and I never felt like I was upside down.
translation.ko: 다시는 거꾸로 있다는 느낌을 받지 않았죠

translation.en: It was so neat to me,
the way your body and mind just switch like that.
[Bob] You feel congested
because you still have all this extra volume in your head.
So your sense of smell and your sense of taste are dull.
We have every hot sauce known to humankind.
translation.ko: 세상에 존재하는 핫소스는 다 갖고 있는데

translation.en: You pour that on absolutely everything.
[officer] I believe birthday wishes are in order, Bob. Is that true?
[Bob] That's true. I got to join the 50-year-old club,
just like these two other guys.
They've been teasing me all day about it.
[officer] Yeah, I know it's not safe to put 50 candles on a cake
translation.ko: 안전 문제상 촛불 50개를 켤 수는 없겠죠

translation.en: in a high-oxygen environment,
but at least make everybody sing to you.
translation.ko: 생일 축하 노래라도 꼭 불러달라고 해요 "미니 생일 케이크 누군가 날 사랑한다는 증거"

translation.en: [Megan] Because I know so well what Bob is doing, I know he's working really hard.
translation.ko: 밥이 무슨 일을 하는지 알아서 고되다는 것도 너무 잘 알아요 "생일 축하해, 내 최애 우주비행사 @ASTROBEHNKEN"

translation.en: I've had those same experiences,
and I know it's hard to be away from your family.
translation.ko: 가족들과 떨어져 있는 게 얼마나 힘든지도 알죠

translation.en: It was important to us to do something special.
translation.ko: 뭔가 특별한 걸 꼭 해주고 싶었어요

translation.en: That encouragement from home, I think, is really important,
that we're thinking of him, that we know what he's doing is hard.
translation.ko: 밥을 향한 그리움을 표현하고 노고를 알아주고 싶었어요

translation.en: You know, the work requires, you know, a lot of dedication,
a lot of focus, a lot of problem-solving, and always a lot of risk.
translation.ko: 집중력, 문제 해결을 요하고 많은 위험을 수반해요

translation.en: Can you guys hear me?
-Yeah, loud and clear. -[Doug] Okay.
Check the PTT's off.
Houston air lock on one.
Uh, we're complete with the, uh, med-ox lab change-out procedure.
translation.ko: 의료용 산소 실험실 전환 절차 완료

translation.en: Going back to step 15 in 1.225.
[Anna] Thanks, Doug, for working the setup so well.
Got us right on timeline. We appreciate it.
Chris and Bob, good morning.
-[Bob] Good morning. -[Chris] Good morning.
[Anna] Okay, with that, we'll step into the post depress.
-[Chris] EV1 copies. -[Bob] EV2 copies.
[Doug] To keep Space Station flying over the Earth,
translation.ko: 우주정거장을 계속 지구 위에 띄워 놓기 위해선

translation.en: it's a constant maintenance program.
We do all these space walks
to either add modules to the space station when we were building it.
translation.ko: 우주정거장을 만들 때는 모듈을 더하기 위해서였고

translation.en: And now it's to replace pieces of equipment
that either are getting old or that fail.
Our mission is essentially to upgrade the batteries.
You know, the power of the space station is maintained by the battery system.
Through the solar arrays, the batteries are recharged.
translation.ko: 태양 전지 배열기를 통해 배터리가 재충전되는데

translation.en: And so just like a rechargeable battery at home,
after many years of these cycles,
and then of course the hot and cold
of being in space between daylight and darkness,
those batteries wear out.
It's a big job, because these batteries are like 400 pounds apiece.
translation.ko: 굉장히 어려운 임무예요 배터리 하나가 180kg나 나가거든요

translation.en: Fortunately, we got both Bob and Chris,
two of our best spacewalkers.
translation.ko: 저희 중 우주 유영을 가장 잘하거든요

translation.en: -Doing good? -[Bob] Yeah.
During my first two missions, I did six space walks
translation.ko: 첫 번째와 두 번째 미션에서 우주 유영을 6번이나 했어요

translation.en: associated with the construction of the space station.
But even though I've done it a couple of times,
translation.ko: 두 번 정도 우주 유영을 해 봤지만

translation.en: it doesn't get easy for me.
You know, there's a lot of pressure in a situation like that,
translation.ko: 우주 유영 상황에서는 엄청난 압박에 시달리죠

translation.en: that, uh, if you don't do your job, uh, successfully,
I could float off into space.
You have to compartmentalize and take deep breaths
translation.ko: 생각을 잘 정리하고 심호흡을 해야 해요

translation.en: so that you can pace yourself and stay focused
translation.ko: 그래야 속도를 조절하며 집중할 수 있어요

translation.en: in the face of this daunting task.
[Doug] Hey, Bob, we're ready with the crew lock depress.
We're gonna take the, uh, depress pump power switch to "on."
[Bob] Okay. Depress pump power coming on.
[Doug] Good luck, guys.
[Anna] Okay, guys, great job. We're gonna pick up slowly.
[Bob] Yeah.
[Anna] Bob, for you, as you get outboard, you're looking for handrail 2075
for your green hook.
[Bob] Copy. 2075.
-It's kind of dark out here, Chris. -[Chris] Yeah, it's kind of dark.
[Bob] How much longer till daylight has me?
[Anna] Approximately three and a half minutes till daylight.
-[Bob] Sun. -[Chris] Here comes the sun again.
[Anna] You should be coming up on the coast of California soon.
If you look south, you might see Hawthorne.
And, Bob, did you wanna go to battery one first?
[Bob] Let's go to battery three first.
[Anna] You'll be going to H1. Confirm socket tape line flush.
translation.ko: H1으로 이동, 소켓 테이프 라인 상태를 확인하세요

translation.en: Looking for eight turns to release the battery.
[Bob] I have control of the batteries?
[Chris] You have control.
[Doug] Okay, copy that.
Looks good, guys.
[Anna] And we're about to enter a night pass.
Bob, I have several cautions and warnings for you when you're ready.
translation.ko: 밥, 준비되면 말해줘요 주의 및 경고 사항이 좀 있어요

translation.en: [Bob] I'm ready.
[Anna] Okay, no sudden movements.
The Bravo 7 torque setting may cause bolt failure.
translation.ko: 브라보 7 토크 설정 때문에 볼트에 문제가 생길 수도 있어요

translation.en: This could result in a non-captive sharp edge and broken shank.
translation.ko: 뾰족한 모서리, 부러진 막대 등이 돌아다닐 수 있단 얘기예요

translation.en: How copy?
[Bob] Copy all.
Is there any good news about this?
[Chris] Sounds scary, Bob. You sure you wanna do that?
translation.ko: 얘기만 들어도 무섭네요, 밥 직접 해도 괜찮겠어요?

translation.en: -[Bob] Obviously. -[Chris] Obviously.
[Bob] It looks equal to me on both sides.
[Chris] I agree.
In the indicator, those locked.
[Anna] Copy, such a good install.
Just a heads-up, you're going into a day pass in about a minute.
[Bob] How about a picture?
It's a good location, good time.
[Chris] Yeah.
[Bob] I don't know if we're gonna make it through another day-night cycle.
translation.ko: 주간, 야간 지역을 또다시 지나가지 않을 수도 있으니까요

translation.en: [Chris] Yeah, that's good.
[Bob] To see the wondrous events that are happening
translation.ko: 우주 유영을 하면서 경이로운 장면을 많이 만나요

translation.en: as you go through a space walk, there's sunrises and sunsets,
translation.ko: 동이 트고 지는 모습을 모두 볼 수 있죠

translation.en: you realize, you know, our world is precious,
translation.ko: 그런 광경을 보고 있자면 세상의 소중함을 깨닫게 되고

translation.en: and you start having appreciation for how little you actually are.
translation.ko: 내가 얼마나 작은 존재인지 깊이 생각하게 돼요

translation.en: And I think every astronaut kind of feels the same way.
translation.ko: 아마 모든 우주비행사가 같은 감정을 느낄 거예요

translation.en: [Megan] As you go around the Earth, you don't see the lines and the borders
that are drawn on maps.
You see the Earth as this one entity,
and it's our home.
You sense its fragility
in this sort of vast blackness of space and this very thin atmosphere
translation.ko: 우주는 너무나 어둡고 광활한데 얇은 대기층만이

translation.en: that's what's keeping us all safe.
You feel very protective, I think,
translation.ko: 그래서 오히려 필사적으로 보호받는 거 같아요

translation.en: and you feel a very strong connection.
[Doug] Even the most hardened, cynical astronauts, you know,
once they've gone to space, it's changed them and for the better.
You know, you look down, and you go, "We're all on this little ball."
translation.ko: 아래를 보면 우리 모두가 사는 작은 구체가 있죠

translation.en: And then you look back into space
and get this overwhelming sense
of, you know, the things we're gonna do next.
[officer] Okay, Neil, we can see you coming down the ladder now.
[Neil] That's one small step for man,
one giant leap for mankind.
[astronaut 1] Oh gee, that's great.
[astronaut 2] Yes, indeed. They've got the flag up now, and you can see the stars and stripes.
translation.ko: 그렇다, 국기를 펼쳤고 별이며 줄무늬도 다 보인다

translation.en: [astronaut 1] Beautiful, just beautiful.
[Neil] Here men from the planet Earth first set foot upon the Moon.
translation.ko: 지구에서 온 인간들이 달에 최초로 발을 내디뎠다

translation.en: July 1969 AD.
They came in peace for all mankind.
translation.ko: 온 인류를 대신해 평화를 전하러 왔다

translation.en: [officer] And welcome home.
[Hans] Landing on the Moon
is singularly the most dramatic event in the history of humanity.
And so this is the leftovers, basically. [laughs]
If you asked what inspired me, this is what inspired me.
-[Bala] Saturn V? -[Hans] Yeah.
I mean, that's what I saw when I was a kid.
This is pretty crazy.
You know how much thrust it had? A million and something?
[Bala] Like the size of that gas generator,
translation.ko: - 아마도… - 가스 발생기 크기 좀 봐요

translation.en: it almost looks like the size of our thrust chamber.
-[Hans] Exactly. -[laughing]
[Hans] Yeah, it's huge.
This is the most powerful rocket that had been built up to date.
translation.ko: 지금까지 제작된 것 중 가장 강력한 로켓이에요

translation.en: [Bala] Yeah, you just need that energy to get--
To the Moon.
-Or to Mars. -Mars, so… [chuckles]
The other thing to recognize is, like, this was all like new stuff
translation.ko: 이 부품들이 다 새것인 점도 인상적이에요

translation.en: that they had made and, like, didn't have much flight experience on.
translation.ko: 직접 제작한 부품으로 비행 경험도 별로 없었죠

translation.en: I mean, we have, like, 80-something flights.
And we're slowly getting into those flights.
Only now are we confident enough to put Bob and Doug in there. [laughs]
translation.ko: 이제야 밥이랑 더그를 태울 만큼 자신감이 붙었죠

translation.en: And they tested it twice and said, "Okay, you guys go in there." [laughs]
translation.ko: 이 사람들은 테스트 두 번 만에 대원들을 태웠고요

translation.en: Yeah.
All right, let's go one step further.
-That's the lunar lander. -[Bala] Yeah.
It looks small, actually.
-I wanna see that inside. -[Bala] Yeah.
They'd be standing up in there, basically.
translation.ko: - 거의 서 있었을 거예요 - 서 있었겠네요

translation.en: There's no… no chair or anything.
[Bala] Yeah, and this had the rudiments of digital computers in there.
translation.ko: 여기엔 디지털 컴퓨터의 기반 기술이 들어가 있어요

translation.en: [Hans] I mean, a computer on this thing,
I don't think there's anything comparable that we have.
translation.ko: 현재 기기 중에는 비교할 만한 게 없네요

translation.en: -A car key is probably smarter. -Yeah.
translation.ko: - 차 키가 더 스마트할 테니까요 - 맞아요

translation.en: But, I mean, they made it work.
-I mean, that's the main thing. -That's the fascinating thing.
Even more dramatic when you think that what they had
translation.ko: 그 당시 임무에 사용한 기기 등을 생각하면

translation.en: in terms of electronics to make that work. Yeah.
[Hans] Pretty inspiring coming back here and just looking at it.
translation.ko: 다시 와서 보니 정말 감명 깊네요

translation.en: Now that we've shown that we can fly astronauts…
translation.ko: 우리도 우주비행사를 우주에 보낼 수 있다는 걸 증명했으니

translation.en: …it's time to go back to the Moon with astronauts again for a longer time
translation.ko: 이제 우주비행사들이 달에 돌아가 좀 더 오래 있을 때가 됐어요

translation.en: and extend our range to Mars.
[Elon] These super smart, super talented people, they believe in the goal.
translation.ko: 정말 똑똑하고 재능 있는 사람들이 같은 목표를 꿈꾸고 있어요

translation.en: A base on the Moon and a city on Mars can happen.
translation.ko: 달에 기지를 세우고 화성에 도시를 건설할 수 있어요

translation.en: I was not sure whether such a path existed before.
translation.ko: 우리가 갈 수 있는 길인지 이전엔 확신할 수 없었는데

translation.en: Now I am confident that such a path exists.
translation.ko: 이젠 갈 수 있는 길이란 확신이 들어요

translation.en: But first, we got a real important mission tomorrow.
translation.ko: 하지만 그전에 먼저 내일 중요한 임무를 완수해야 해요

translation.en: [officer] Good morning, Bob and Doug.
We have a special message for you to start your day.
translation.ko: 하루를 시작하기 전에 특별 메시지가 있어요

translation.en: [Theo] Rise and shine, Daddy. We love you.
We can't wait to see you. Wake up, wake up!
[Jack] I'm happy you went into space,
but I'm even happier that you're coming back home.
translation.ko: 집에 온다고 하니까 훨씬 더 좋아요

translation.en: [Theo] Hurry home so we can go get my dog.
[Jack] We love you, Dad.
[Bob] We're about to embark on the final portion of the journey.
translation.ko: 곧 이번 여정의 마지막 단계를 맞이하게 돼요

translation.en: And as I look forward to heading back home,
translation.ko: 저도 집에 가는 게 너무 좋지만

translation.en: my son and Doug's son are really excited not only to get their fathers back
translation.ko: 양쪽 집 아이들이 정말 좋아해요 아빠가 돌아와서도 좋아하지만

translation.en: but to get our Apatosaurus, our zero-G indicator,
translation.ko: 무중력 상태를 알려주는 친구인 공룡을 다시 만날 수 있으니까요

translation.en: that they nominated to go with us.
And so for Jack and Theo,
uh, Tremor the Apatosaurus is, uh, headed home soon.
translation.ko: 공룡 트레머가 곧 집에 돌아갈 거예요

translation.en: [Megan] Reentry is obviously the next big milestone,
and so everything has to work really, really well.
translation.ko: 그러니 모든 게 순조롭게 진행되면 좋겠네요

translation.en: [Anna] Dragon, SpaceX. Comm check.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 통신 확인 바란다

translation.en: [Doug] SpaceX, Dragon. Comm checks. Dragon to ground.
translation.ko: 스페이스X, 여기는 드래건 지상 통신 발신 확인 바란다

translation.en: [Megan] It's hard to prepare yourself.
You don't know exactly what you're gonna feel.
translation.ko: 어떤 감정을 느끼게 될지 알 수 없으니까요

translation.en: But there's a part of you that can't let go
translation.ko: 하지만 마음속 어딘가 일이 잘못될 수도 있다는

translation.en: of that sort of, you know, hopefully irrational fear
translation.ko: 극복할 수 없고 설명할 수 없는 두려움이

translation.en: that something could go wrong.
[Anna] The final reconfigurations for undock are complete and nominal.
translation.ko: 도킹 해제 전 마지막 재구성이 정상적으로 완료됐다

translation.en: [Megan] Am I gonna be nervous? Absolutely.
But I want my son to experience the joy and excitement of that moment
translation.ko: 하지만 아이가 이 순간의 즐거움과 기쁨만 경험하도록

translation.en: and try to keep all of the… the nervousness to myself.
[Anna] The ground is go for undocking.
Please confirm your visors are down
and that you are ready for undock and departure.
translation.ko: 도킹 해제 및 출발 준비는 끝났는지 확인 바란다

translation.en: [Doug] Our visors are down, and we're ready for departure.
[Anna] Dragon, SpaceX. Separation confirmed.
[Chris] Endeavour, Station. Bob and Doug,
translation.ko: 인데버, 여기는 정거장 밥 그리고 더그

translation.en: it's been an honor to serve with you.
Safe travels and have a successful landing.
Godspeed.
Endeavour copies all. Thanks, Chris.
translation.ko: 여기는 인데버, 메시지 수신 완료 고마워요, 크리스

translation.en: Bob and I, we're just excited to get back home.
translation.ko: 밥도, 저도 집에 돌아갈 생각에 마냥 신났어요

translation.en: But you can never let your guard down, especially on a first flight.
translation.ko: 하지만 긴장을 놓칠 순 없죠 첫 비행에서는 더더욱요

translation.en: You know, you really have to do the whole mission end to end.
translation.ko: 미션의 시작부터 끝까지 임무에 충실해야 해요

translation.en: There was a time when we thought,
"Well, we just get through the ascent, and we'll be fine."
But then we had Columbia.
[flight director] Everything look good to you?
Control and rates and everything is nominal, right?
translation.ko: 제어 장치 및 속도 등 전부 정상인가?

translation.en: [officer] Control has been stable. We have good trims.
translation.ko: 제어 장치도 안정됐고 트림도 잘 설정됐다

translation.en: -I don't see anything out of the ordinary. -[flight director] Okay.
[astronaut 1] This is amazing. It's really getting fairly bright out there.
translation.ko: 정말 놀라운 광경이네요 바깥이 아주 환해졌어요

translation.en: [astronaut 2] Yeah, you definitely don't want to be outside now.
[Doug] Both Bob and I were on the runway where the shuttle would be landing.
translation.ko: 밥이랑 같이 우주선이 착륙할 활주로에 있었어요

translation.en: I remember them knocking on the window
and saying to us that they'd lost, uh, comm,
uh, and data and tracking from Columbia.
translation.ko: 데이터도 잃고 추적도 안 된다는 거예요

translation.en: [officer 1] Columbia, Houston, comm check.
translation.ko: 컬럼비아, 여기는 휴스턴 통신 확인 바란다

translation.en: Columbia, Houston, UHF comm check.
translation.ko: 컬럼비아, 여기는 휴스턴 UHF 통신 확인

translation.en: [officer 2] We do not have any valid data at this time.
-[crowd clamoring] -[woman] Oh my God.
[news anchor] We've got some breaking news.
There you see what appears to be multiple pieces of the shuttle.
translation.ko: 우주선이 여러 개로 조각난 듯한 모습이 보입니다

translation.en: We can only hope that what we're seeing is not the worst.
translation.ko: 비록 이런 광경이 펼쳐졌지만 최악의 상황은 아니길 바랍니다

translation.en: [Doug] When landing time came and the shuttle didn't come,
translation.ko: 착륙 시간이 됐는데도 우주선은 오지 않았고

translation.en: we were there in the room
when they told the families what they think had happened
translation.ko: 생존 가능성이 희박하다는 말을 가족들에게 전했어요

translation.en: and that it was likely not survivable
and that they were, you know, gonna do the best they could,
but when the vehicle broke up at 200, 250,000 feet,
that it's not likely that anybody survived.
Just seeing the pieces of Columbia,
pieces of the crew module and helmets and those kinds of things,
translation.ko: 대원 모듈의 조각들 헬멧과 같은 물건들을 본 순간

translation.en: you know, that… that leaves an impression that I think you never ever…
translation.ko: 모든 이미지가 머리에 각인됐어요 평생 잊을 수 없을 거예요

translation.en: you never really get over.
When you lose a rocket with a payload on it,
translation.ko: 탑재 화물이 있는 상태에서 우주선이 소실되면

translation.en: that is a bad situation.
But if you lose a rocket with a crew on it,
translation.ko: 하지만 대원이 승선한 상태에서 우주선이 소실되면

translation.en: that… that is an order of magnitude different.
And in the end, you don't want anybody to ever have to go through that again.
translation.ko: 다시는 이런 일이 벌어지지 않기를 바랄 뿐이죠

translation.en: [Kiko] We have been preparing for Bob and Doug to come home.
translation.ko: 밥과 더그의 귀환을 위해 이런저런 준비를 했어요

translation.en: You know, as soon as that capsule released,
uh, and we undocked,
the nerves popped up again,
the general feeling of like, "Oh man, we're in free flight."
translation.ko: 우주 한가운데 떠 있다는 막연한 두려움과 함께

translation.en: And these boys are coming home. It's happening.
translation.ko: 두 사람이 돌아온다는 게 실감이 났어요

translation.en: Um, there's no turning back at this point.
So… it's time to rock and roll,
translation.ko: 그러니까… 이제 실전에 돌입할 때가 됐어요

translation.en: talk to the recovery dudes, and… and get Bob and Doug home.
translation.ko: 회수팀과 얘기도 좀 하고 밥, 더그를 집에 데려와야죠

translation.en: [male host] Everything's been going very smoothly for Bob and Doug

translation.ko: 밥, 더그의 상황은 매끄럽게 진행되고 있어요

translation.en: Now just ready and waiting to begin the reentry process.
translation.ko: 지금은 준비를 갖추고 재진입 과정 개시를 기다려요

translation.en: [Jessie] Yeah, really exciting day as we approach splashdown here
translation.ko: 착륙 시간이 가까워질수록 하루가 더 흥미진진해지네요

translation.en: in a matter of a few hours…
[Hans] I've gotta talk to these two guys.
[Jessie] …to think that this all started two months ago, and here we are.
-[Hans] Did you get some sleep? -[man] Yeah. A few hours.
translation.ko: - 잠 좀 잤어요? - 네, 몇 시간 잤어요

translation.en: -[Hans] A few hours? -[man laughs] Yeah.
-[Hans] How's everything looking? -[man] Ready to go.
Yeah, everything's looking great. Dragon's in good shape.
translation.ko: 다 아주 좋아요 드래건 상태도 좋고요

translation.en: [Hans] All right, good luck.
-Good luck. -[man] All right, good luck.
[Hans] Oh, look at that.
They seem super calm.
I guess it doesn't go over well when they're nervous. [laughs]
translation.ko: 하긴 두 사람이 불안해하면 곤란하긴 하죠

translation.en: Actually, you can see they're nervous. They do this… [laughs]
translation.ko: 잘 보니 둘 다 긴장했네요 손을 이렇게 해요

translation.en: You know, every once in a while. [laughs]
I think reentry is the part that everybody hates.
You're in a stable orbit around the Earth,
and then you do a reentry burn.
That's a thrust maneuver that reduces your velocity
so that you start descending
until you hit dense atmosphere
and you can't get a radio signal out anymore.
It's called "blackout."
For a few minutes, you're in the dark on the ground,
translation.ko: 몇 분 동안 지상에 있는 팀은 어둠을 지나게 돼요

translation.en: and you have no idea what happens.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 벌어졌는지 알 수 없죠

translation.en: Okay, blackout here is 18:36,
and you land at 48.
So that's 12 minutes before we land, is the blackout.
[Bala] What altitude is that?
-A hundred and five? -[Hans] So…
[Bala] A hundred and ninety-five kilometers?
-Does that sound too high? -Uh, it does sound a little bit high.
translation.ko: 근데 너무 높지 않아요? 좀 높은 거 같네요

translation.en: -Found it? -[Bala] Yeah.
Forty-seven.
-[Hans] Okay, fifty. -[Bala] Fifty. Okay.
[Hans] So it happens between 50 and 30 kilometers.
That means you fall from 30 kilometers to six kilometers in two minutes?
-[Bala] That's crazy. -[Hans] That seems crazy fast, man.
translation.ko: - 말도 안 돼요 - 네, 진짜 빠르네요

translation.en: -[Bala] Yeah. -[Hans] Remarkable.
You're moving at high speed, and you're using the atmosphere to brake.
It's a lot of energy.
It gets hot on the outside,
and on the inside, you see the fire flying by the window.
You need a heat shield that is perfect.
And after you get through the atmosphere, you still have to deploy the parachutes.
translation.ko: 대기권을 통과한 후에는 낙하산을 펼쳐야 해요

translation.en: They come out, then two minutes later, you deploy the chutes. It's pretty quick.
translation.ko: 통과 후 2분 만에 펼치니 엄청 빠르게 진행되는 거예요

translation.en: [Bala] In my mind, it's probably the parachutes
that are the most significant thing that needs to work.
translation.ko: 낙하산이 중요한 만큼 더 작업을 해야 할 거 같아요

translation.en: In spite of all the testing we've done, that's still one of the riskiest parts.
translation.ko: 테스트를 그렇게 많이 했지만 여전히 위험 부담이 너무 크잖아요

translation.en: [Hans] Right.
[Bala] And, you know, we haven't had a splashdown since the Apollo program.
translation.ko: 게다가 아폴로 프로그램 이후 물에 착륙한 적도 없고요

translation.en: [Hans] Yeah.
[officer] Dragon, SpaceX for entry brief.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 진입 브리핑을 시작한다

translation.en: [Bob] Go ahead.
The recovery team is go, and the weather is great,

translation.ko: 재진입을 앞두고 우주선 상태도 굉장히 좋다

translation.en: No health issues at this time.
-[Bob] Copy. -[beeping]
[Elon] How long until they hit the atmosphere?
translation.ko: 대기권 도달까지 얼마나 남았나요? 5분 후에 시퀀스가 시작돼요

translation.en: [Hans] They go into the sequence in five minutes.
I'm actually here for the deorbit burn.
To make sure that goes well.
-Deorbit burn's coming up now? -[Hans] Yeah.
[Hans] Well…
Everything's looking good, I think.
Yeah, well, it certainly has been quite a journey.
[Hans] Crazy. Here we are, right?
[Elon] Yes, 18 years.
-[Hans] Are you nervous? -[Elon] Yeah, I am.
[officer] Dragon, SpaceX. Deorbit burn start.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 궤도 이탈 점화를 시작한다

translation.en: [Bob] We copy. Go.
[man] Cool as a cucumber, because they're not breathing very heavy,
'cause their CO2's not going up.
-[Hans] That's good. -[man] Yeah.
[officer] Dragon, SpaceX. Deorbit burn complete.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 궤도 이탈 점화가 완료됐다

translation.en: Performance nominal.
Nose cone closure initiated.
All right, boys.
[officer] Brace for entry.
[Bob] Copy.
[Kiko] All right.
Here we go.
[Hans] Four G's. That's moving.

translation.en: We will see you on the other side at 18:42.
[Bob] Dragon copy, 18:42.
[Kiko] Okay, we're in blackout.
[officer] Dragon, SpaceX. Comm check.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 통신 확인 바란다

translation.en: Dragon, SpaceX. Comm check.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 통신 확인 바란다

translation.en: [Kiko] Jesus, dude. This thing is so long.
[officer] Dragon, SpaceX. Comm check.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 통신 확인 바란다

translation.en: Dragon, SpaceX. Comm check.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 통신 확인 바란다

translation.en: [Kiko] Come on, where is it?
Let's find that puppy.
Oh, there it is.
[officer] Dragon, SpaceX. Comm check.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 통신 확인 바란다

translation.en: [Bob] Copy, I heard you loud and clear. We're about 3.9 G's.
translation.ko: 오버, 크게 잘 들린다 현재 3.9G 상태다

translation.en: [officer] Copy, we've got you.
-[Kiko] All right. -[man 1] Hell yeah.
[man 2] Coming in hot.
[officer] Passing 15 kilometers, brace for drogue window.
translation.ko: 15km 지점을 지나고 있다 보조 낙하산에 대비하기 바란다

translation.en: [Bob] Copy, we're braced.
[Kiko] Come on, baby.
[officer] Visual, two drogues out.
translation.ko: 낙하산 두 개가 펼쳐진 게 보인다

translation.en: [Bob] Oh yeah, we felt it.
[Kiko] Slow down, baby.
[officer] Drogue descent rate nominal.
-[Kiko] Nice. -[clapping]
Yep.
All right.
Let's get these mains out.
[Kiko] Inflate, baby.
Inflate.
Come on.
Come on, come on, come on, come on.
[officer] We are visual on four chutes out.
-[man 1] Ooh. -[man 2] Yeah.
[Kiko] Hold on. Almost down to the ground.
[officer] Main chute decent rate nominal.
Passing through 700 meters.
[Hans] And we're back to seven meters per second. Nothing.
It's, like, sitting there.
Boom.
Slowing.
[officer] Six hundred meters.
Six hundred meters.
Two hundred meters.
We are braced for splashdown.
[man] Copy. Brace for splashdown.
-All right! Whoo! -[all applauding]
[officer] Welcome back to planet Earth, and thanks for flying SpaceX.
translation.ko: 지구에 돌아온 걸 환영합니다 스페이스X에 승선해 줘서 고마워요

translation.en: [Kiko] Hell yeah!
Yeah!
All right.
Everything's good?
[Hans] Everything was great. This was super smooth.
translation.ko: 다 아주 잘됐어요 정말 매끄럽게 진행됐네요

translation.en: Okay.
[Kiko] Are there small boats out there?
That doesn't look like a 45-footer to me. That looks like a…
Now there's a… Who the hell is this?
-[Hans] It's a boat there. Not ours. -[Elon] Oh, it's someone else?
translation.ko: - 우리 말고 다른 배가 있어요 - 다른 사람 거라고요?

translation.en: [Hans] Not ours. Yeah, these are not our boats.
translation.ko: 우린 아니에요 우리 배는 확실히 아니에요

translation.en: -[Elon] Who is that? Just random people? -[Hans] Just random people.
-[man] They're just like-- -Oh my gosh.
translation.ko: - 그냥 이런 식으로… - 말도 안 돼

translation.en: Look at this, dude, just like fucking 30 jabroni boats
translation.ko: 이거 좀 봐요 엉뚱한 배가 30척이나 있어요

translation.en: just show up out of nowhere.
[chuckling] You got a front-row seat.
[officer] Dragon, SpaceX. Stand by for side hatch opening and egress.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 해치 개방, 하선까지 대기 바란다

translation.en: [Bob] Copy. We're ready.
[man] What's up, fellas?
[host] All right, so they're getting set up.
They're gonna work to get Bob Behnken,

translation.ko: 이번 미션의 공동 작전 사령관이죠 밥이 캡슐에서 나왔습니다

translation.en: [Jessie] We got a thumbs-up,
indicating that things are going well.
[host] And now spacecraft commander Doug Hurley making his way out of the capsule.
translation.ko: 이제 우주선 사령관 더그 헐리가 캡슐에서 나옵니다

translation.en: There we go. Another thumbs-up.
-Don. -[Don] Thank you.
[Gwynne] Will you have some?
Yeah! Whoo!
Here's to happiness and to Bob and Doug safely home.
translation.ko: 행복 그리고 밥, 더그의 무사 귀환을 위해

translation.en: No doubt.
[Doug] It had been a couple of months since we had launched,
so I was just really excited to see my family.
But first, we were going to do a little bit of a press event.
translation.ko: 하지만 그전에 언론과 먼저 만나야 했죠

translation.en: Six-year-olds, you know, they didn't have him in handcuffs or anything,
translation.ko: 수갑을 채워 놓은 것도 아니니 여섯 살 된 아들이

translation.en: so he broke free and ran to me at the airplane.
It was just awesome to see him.
I'm glad I didn't fall down the steps
when he tried to tackle me at the base of the stairs.
All right, um, we're not gonna stand right now.
For those of you who have done this before,
you know it's not pleasant standing for a few hours after you get back.
translation.ko: 돌아오고 몇 시간 동안은 서 있는 게 힘들거든요

translation.en: Five hours ago, we were in a spaceship bobbing around,
translation.ko: 5시간 전만 해도 우주를 정처 없이 떠다니며

translation.en: making prank satellite phone calls to whoever we could get ahold of.
translation.ko: 위성 전화로 아무한테나 장난 전화를 걸었는데요

translation.en: You know, this has been a, uh…
quite an odyssey the last five years
since Bob and I started working on this program.
translation.ko: 이 프로그램에 참여했는데 대모험의 과정이었다고 생각합니다

translation.en: And to be where we are now,
translation.ko: 드래건의 첫 번째 유인 비행을 마친 지금

translation.en: the first crewed flight of Dragon,
is just unbelievable.
There's something special about having that capability
to launch and… and bring your own astronauts home.
translation.ko: 이 모든 일엔 특별한 능력이 필요해요

translation.en: I just wanna thank you all for coming out today
and celebrating what was accomplished.
translation.ko: 오늘 이 자리에 와 주셔서 정말 감사합니다

translation.en: -Thank you, all. -[crowd applauding, cheering]
[Elon] Whoo-hoo! Yeah.
After these great words that were spoken,
um, I… I'm not sure I have much to add.
I mean, I really came here
'cause I just wanted to see Bob and Doug, to be totally frank.
Like, my entire adrenaline, it was just dumped, you know.
[laughing] It's like…
Like, "Thank God." [huffs]
You know?
You know, I think this is an achievement of humanity,
translation.ko: 저는 이 모든 게 인류 모두의 성과라고 생각하고

translation.en: and… and I think the whole world can look at this as a new era.
We're gonna have a base on the Moon,
and we're gonna have… send people to Mars.
Have… and make life multi-planetary.
And I think this… this day heralds a new age of space exploration.
translation.ko: 오늘이 새로운 우주 탐험 시대의 시작을 알렸다고 생각합니다

translation.en: [woman 1] You're looking at the Crew Dragon spacecraft and Falcon 9 rocket
translation.ko: 보이는 건 크루 드래건 우주선과 팔콘 9 로켓으로

translation.en: set to launch four astronauts to the International Space Station
translation.ko: 6개월간 지속될 과학 미션을 위해 우주비행사 4명을 싣고

translation.en: on a six-month science mission.
This crew is about to fly in the exact same capsule
translation.ko: 대원들은 나사 우주비행사 밥 벵컨과 더그 헐리가

translation.en: that first flew NASA astronauts Bob Behnken and Doug Hurley
translation.ko: 작년 데모-2 테스트 비행에서 최초로 탑승했던 캡슐을

translation.en: in last year's Demo-2 test flight.
This is the second crew to fly on a commercial spacecraft
translation.ko: 대원들은 두 번째로 상업 우주선에 탑승하게 되며

translation.en: for this new era of human spaceflight.
translation.ko: 인류 우주 탐험의 새로운 시대를 이어갑니다

translation.en: [woman 1] And here they come, the Crew-2 astronauts
taking their first steps outside before their journey to space.
translation.ko: 우주로 가기 전 밖으로 첫발을 내딛습니다

translation.en: [man] Yay!
[Theo] Hey, Mommy!
[woman 1] Pilot Megan McArthur in the front.
Hi, buddy!
[Theo] Hey, Mommy, I love you.
[woman 2] Looks like Bob Behnken is there with their son.
They are a power couple, and I love it. [laughs]
[Bob] Now it's time for Megan's mission.
It's super exciting for us
that she's gonna be able to ride the same Dragon capsule.
translation.ko: 그대로 탈 수 있다니 정말 신나요

translation.en: And so I need to step in in the backup role
and flip-flop and make sure our son Theo gets everything he needs.
translation.ko: 메건과 위치를 바꿔서 아들을 잘 보살필 거예요

translation.en: [Theo] See you in six months.
See you in six months. I'm gonna miss you.
translation.ko: 6개월 후에 만나자 많이 보고 싶을 거야

translation.en: [Megan] My husband flew the Crew Dragon last year
and happened to be in the same seat that I'll be in.
translation.ko: 우연히도 제가 남편이 앉았던 그 자리에 앉게 됐어요

translation.en: This time it's Mom's turn, and I'm gonna be up there for six months.
translation.ko: 이번엔 엄마 차례예요 6개월 동안 있을 예정이죠

translation.en: [Megan] As our son gets older,
he's starting to build an awareness of what it is that we do.
translation.ko: 저희가 어떤 일을 하는지 조금씩 알아가고 있어요

translation.en: We want him to understand
we think it's important to explore and to push the boundaries
translation.ko: 아이가 탐험의 중요성과 한계를 넓혀가는 것의 중요성을

translation.en: of what we're capable of.
[woman 1] The crew now on their way to Launch Complex 39A,
ready for their ride to the space station.
I embrace this dawn of this age of commercialization of space.
translation.ko: 상업화된 우주 시대의 새벽을 두 팔 벌려 환영하고 싶어요

translation.en: Our mission proved that we could get humans in the low Earth orbit
translation.ko: 저희 미션을 통해 지구 궤도에 인간을 보낼 수 있단 걸 증명했고

translation.en: and kind of planted the seed for how we're gonna go beyond that.
translation.ko: 앞으로 있을 더 많은 발전의 씨앗을 심었다고 생각해요

translation.en: [Bob] As we go forward, we wanna accomplish all those missions
that help us understand what's out there,
translation.ko: 우주를 더 깊이 이해하는 것도 중요하지만

translation.en: but at the same time,
we have to figure out the smart way
to take care of the resources and our solar system
translation.ko: 자원과 태양계를 돌볼 수 있어야 해요

translation.en: and not trash Mars when the opportunity presents itself.
translation.ko: 그래야 기회가 왔을 때 화성을 망치지 않을 수 있어요

translation.en: [Doug] Of course, there will be questions and challenges,
translation.ko: 물론 질문도 많고 난관도 많을 거예요

translation.en: like how we're gonna govern something like that.
But if we can continue to get people into space,
translation.ko: 하지만 사람들을 계속해서 우주에 보내는 게

translation.en: I can't imagine it doesn't make us better.
translation.ko: 세상을 이롭게 할 거라고 굳게 믿어요

translation.en: [officer] Elon, are you go?
[Elon] Absolutely.
[officer] MJ, we're here. We just spoke to Elon. He's ready to go.
translation.ko: 여기는 MJ 일론이 시작해도 좋다고 한다

translation.en: [Elon] We should think more about, what's the future we want?
translation.ko: 우리가 어떤 미래를 원하는지 잘 생각해 봐야 해요

translation.en: What has the happy ending?
For me, it's, you know, making sure we become a spacefaring civilization.
translation.ko: 전 인류가 우주를 여행하는 세상에 답이 있다고 생각해요

translation.en: [officer] Dragon, SpaceX. You are go for launch.
translation.ko: 드래건, 여기는 스페이스X 발사 허가가 떨어졌다

translation.en: [Elon] But it's very important to appreciate this is not inevitable.
translation.ko: 하지만 이게 불가피한 일은 아님을 알아둘 필요가 있어요

translation.en: People are mistaken when they think that technology just automatically improves.
It does not automatically improve.
If you look at great civilizations like ancient Egypt,
translation.ko: 고대 이집트와 같이 발전한 문명을 보면

translation.en: and they were able to make the pyramids, and they forgot how to do that.
translation.ko: 피라미드를 만들 수 있었지만 지금은 방법을 잊어버렸어요

translation.en: And the Romans, they built these incredible aqueducts.
translation.ko: 로마를 봐도 똑같아요 고도의 송수로를 만들었지만

translation.en: They forgot how to do it.
In 1969, we were able to send somebody to the Moon,
and we forgot how to do that.
[officer 1] T-minus 15 seconds.
[Elon] The window of opportunity is open right now
to make life multi-planetary.
But we cannot count on it being open for a long time.
translation.ko: 하지만 언제까지나 그 문이 열려 있지는 않아요

translation.en: [officer 1] Ten, nine, eight, seven…
[Elon] We need to take advantage of that window while it is open.
translation.ko: 문이 열려 있는 동안에 기회를 활용해야 해요

translation.en: [officer 1] …four, three, two, one.
[officer 2] Endeavour launches once again.
Four astronauts from three countries on Crew-2
now making their way to the one and only International Space Station.
[officer 3] Crew Dragon flying free.
